original: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: s'u tra aa lam ka ra britti bh'a shyam /
analyzed: s'u tra aa lam ka ra britti bh'a shyam /
translated: Sutra-alamkara-britti-bhasyam

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: mdo sde rgyan gyi 'grel bshad /
analyzed: mdo sde rgyan gyi 'grel bshad /
translated: Explanation of the Ornament of the Mahayana Sutras

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the noble ManjushriüîΩThe three jewels, a treasure of jewels,üîΩThe true Shakyamuni, the eldest son of the Sage,üîΩThe Victorious One himself, the bull, and his younger brother,üîΩDevoted to the son without attachment,

original: dkon mchog gsum po rin chen gter gyur dang // yang dag sh'a ka thub sras kyi thu bo dang // rgyal ba bdag nyid khyu mchog de de dang // chags med sras kyi gcung la mos pa dang // bstan bcos gsal bar 'gro la snang byed dang //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum po rin chen gter gyur dang // yang dag sh'a ka thub sras kyi thu bo dang // rgyal ba bdag nyid khyu mchog de de dang // chags med sras kyi gcung la mos pa dang // bstan bcos gsal bar 'gro la snang byed dang //
translated: The treatise that illuminates the path of the clear,

original: bla ma gtso bo gang las 'di thos pa //
analyzed: bla ma gtso bo gang las 'di thos pa //
translated: The principal guru from whom this was heard,

original: rtag par kun la bdag gis sar gtugs te //
analyzed: rtag par kun la bdag gis sar gtugs te //
translated: I constantly bow down to all of them

original: gus dang bcas pas spyi bos phyag 'tshal nas //
analyzed: gus dang bcas pas spyi bos phyag 'tshal nas //
translated: And with devotion, my head at their feet,üîΩThe meaning to be contemplated, my foolish mind,

original: don la bsam bya bdag blo blun pa dang // bstan bcos 'di yi tshig don zab pa yang //
analyzed: don la bsam bya bdag blo blun pa dang // bstan bcos 'di yi tshig don zab pa yang //
translated: And the profound words and meaning of this treatise

original: 'grel ba'i bsam pa bdag la ma byung bas //
analyzed: 'grel ba'i bsam pa bdag la ma byung bas //
translated: I have not thought about in a commentary,

original: de phyir bdag la phan phyir cung zad bya //
analyzed: de phyir bdag la phan phyir cung zad bya //
translated: Therefore, for my own benefit, I will do a little.

original: theg pa chen po mdo sde'i rgyan gyi lus su bzhag pa ni /
analyzed: theg pa chen po mdo sde'i rgyan gyi lus su bzhag pa ni /
translated: The body of the Ornament of Mahayana Sutras is as follows.

original: mdor na rigs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas /
analyzed: mdor na rigs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas /
translated: In brief, it teaches that a bodhisattva who is abiding in the lineage generates the thought of unexcelled perfect enlightenment

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab @2a * //üîΩpar bya ba de ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab @2a * // par bya ba de ston to //
translated: and trains in the bodhisattva deeds.

original: de la rigs la gnas pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la rigs la gnas pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Abiding in the lineage

original: rigs ni bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba'i sa bon la bya ste /
analyzed: rigs ni bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba'i sa bon la bya ste /
translated: The lineage is the seed of attaining enlightenment, the highest enlightenment.

original: de la rigs zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: de la rigs zhes kyang bya /
translated: It is called the lineage,

original: gzhi zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: gzhi zhes kyang bya /
translated: the basis,

original: nye bar rton pa zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: nye bar rton pa zhes kyang bya /
translated: the support,

original: rgyu zhes kyang bya /üîΩbrtan pa zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: rgyu zhes kyang bya / brtan pa zhes kyang bya /
translated: the cause,üîΩthe stability,

original: gnas zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: gnas zhes kyang bya /
translated: the abode,

original: sngon du 'gro ba zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: sngon du 'gro ba zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: and the precursor.

original: 'di dag ni rigs kyi ming gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rigs kyi ming gi rnam grangs so //
translated: These are synonyms for the lineage.

original: rigs de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rigs de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That lineage is, in brief, of two types:

original: rang bzhin la gnas pa dang / yang dag par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin la gnas pa dang / yang dag par bsgrub pa'o //
translated: the naturally existing lineage and the developed lineage.

original: de la rang bzhin la gnas pa'i rigs ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skye mched kyi khyad par 'phral la rnyed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin la gnas pa'i rigs ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skye mched kyi khyad par 'phral la rnyed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The natural family of bodhisattvas is not a special sense base that is newly acquired.

original: 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'ongs pa /
analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'ongs pa /
translated: It has come down from beginningless cyclic existence,

original: chos nyid kyis rnyed pa ste /
analyzed: chos nyid kyis rnyed pa ste /
translated: and is acquired by the reality nature.

original: de dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba'i skal ba yod pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba'i skal ba yod pa'o //
translated: Since one possesses it, one has the fortune to awaken to supreme enlightenment.

original: yang dag par bsgrub pa'i rigs ni ma nges pa'i rigs can rnams dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa dang / sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba la goms par byas pas las nges pa'i rigs su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par bsgrub pa'i rigs ni ma nges pa'i rigs can rnams dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa dang / sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba la goms par byas pas las nges pa'i rigs su gyur pa ste /
translated: The family of correct practice is the family of those of unfixed potential who become of fixed potential through reliance on a spiritual master and through habituation to the roots of virtue.

original: skabs 'dir ni gnyi ga la bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni gnyi ga la bya bar rigs so //
translated: In this context, both are appropriate.

original: de la @2b rang bzhin la gnas pa'i rigs ni 'bras bu ma grub cing ma byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la @2b rang bzhin la gnas pa'i rigs ni 'bras bu ma grub cing ma byung ba'o //
translated: The natural family is not established as a result and does not arise.

original: de la rigs kyi 'bras bu ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de la rigs kyi 'bras bu ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa ste /
translated: The result of the spiritual gene is the generation of the will for enlightenment and the practice of the six perfections.

original: byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa pha rol tu phyin par spyod pa la ma zhugs na rigs yod par mi rtog pas na phra ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa pha rol tu phyin par spyod pa la ma zhugs na rigs yod par mi rtog pas na phra ba yin no //
translated: The spiritual gene is subtle, because one cannot conceive of the existence of the gene in one who has not generated the will for enlightenment and who has not begun the practice of the perfections.

original: yang dag par bsgrub pa'i rigs ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa rags pa zhes bya ste /üîΩrang bzhin gyi rigs la ltos nas /
analyzed: yang dag par bsgrub pa'i rigs ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa rags pa zhes bya ste / rang bzhin gyi rigs la ltos nas /
translated: The spiritual gene as actualized is called gross, because it is the result.

original: de tsam du zab pa dang phra ba ma yin pas rags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de tsam du zab pa dang phra ba ma yin pas rags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is not as profound and subtle as the natural gene, and so it is called gross.

original: rigs de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas las kyang 'phags pa yin na /
analyzed: rigs de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas las kyang 'phags pa yin na /
translated: The bodhisattvas who possess that gene are superior to the disciples and hermit buddhas,

original: so so'i skye bo gzhan la lta ci smos te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo gzhan la lta ci smos te /
translated: to say nothing of other ordinary beings.

original: de bas na rigs de ni bla na med pa mchog khyad par can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rigs de ni bla na med pa mchog khyad par can zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that gene is called the unsurpassed, the highest, and the special.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gnyis po 'di dag ni mdor na rnam par dag par bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis po 'di dag ni mdor na rnam par dag par bya ba ste /
translated: In brief, these two, the natural and the developed, are what is to be purified.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par dag par bya ba dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par dag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par dag par bya ba dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par dag par bya ba'o //
translated: purification from the obscurations of the afflictions and purification from the obscurations to omniscience.

original: de la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dag ni /
analyzed: de la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dag ni /
translated: Those of the lineages of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par dag pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par dag pa tsam du zad de /
translated: are only purified from the obscurations of the afflictions.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par dag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par dag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not purified from the obscurations to omniscience.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can dag ni /
translated: Those of the bodhisattva lineage

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyi ga las rnam par grol ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyi ga las rnam par grol ba /
translated: are liberated from both the obscurations of the afflictions and the obscurations to omniscience.

original: de bas na mchog khyad par can bla na med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na mchog khyad par can bla na med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they should be known as the supreme, the special, the unsurpassed.

original: yang rnam pa bzhis byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas las khyad par du 'phags par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa bzhis byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas las khyad par du 'phags par rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, bodhisattvas should be known as superior to the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas in four ways.

original: bzhi po de gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi po de gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: dbang po dang / rab tu sgrub ba dang / mkhas pa dang / 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang / rab tu sgrub ba dang / mkhas pa dang / 'bras bu'o //
translated: They are faculties, practice, expertise, and result.

original: de la dbang po'i khyad par ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rang bzhin gyis dbang po rno'o //
analyzed: de la dbang po'i khyad par ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rang bzhin gyis dbang po rno'o //
translated: The difference in faculties: Bodhisattvas have sharp faculties by nature.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams ni rang bzhin gyis dbang po 'bring ngo //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams ni rang bzhin gyis dbang po 'bring ngo //
translated: Pratyekabuddhas have middling faculties by nature.

original: nyan thos rnams ni rang bzhin gyis dbang po tha ma'o //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni rang bzhin gyis dbang po tha ma'o //
translated: Sravakas have dull faculties by nature.

original: rab tu sgrub pa'i khyad par ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag bdag la phan pa dang bde ba bya ba'i phyir zhugs shing sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu sgrub pa'i khyad par ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag bdag la phan pa dang bde ba bya ba'i phyir zhugs shing sgrub pa'o //
translated: The difference in practice: Sravakas and pratyekabuddhas practice and train in order to benefit themselves and make themselves happy.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dag ni bdag la phan pa dang / gzhan la @3a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dag ni bdag la phan pa dang / gzhan la @3a * //
translated: Bodhisattvas practice and train in order to benefit themselves and others,

original: phan pa dang / 'gro ba mang po la phan pa dang / 'gro ba mang po la bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang mi'i skye bo mang po'i don dang / bde ba dang / phan pa'i phyir rab tu zhugs pa yin pas na /
analyzed: phan pa dang / 'gro ba mang po la phan pa dang / 'gro ba mang po la bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang mi'i skye bo mang po'i don dang / bde ba dang / phan pa'i phyir rab tu zhugs pa yin pas na /
translated: in order to benefit many beings, to bring happiness to many beings, out of compassion for the world, for the sake of the great multitude of beings, for the sake of gods and humans, and in order to bring them benefit, happiness, and well-being.

original: de dag la mkhas pa'i khyad par ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dang / bden pa la mkhas par byed pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: de dag la mkhas pa'i khyad par ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa dang / bden pa la mkhas par byed pa tsam du zad de /
translated: The difference in their expertise is that the disciples and hermit buddhas are only experts in the aggregates, constituents, and sense-fields, in dependent origination, in what is possible and impossible, and in the truths.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rig pa'i gnas lnga thams cad la mkhas par byed pas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rig pa'i gnas lnga thams cad la mkhas par byed pas so //
translated: The bodhisattvas are experts in all five sciences.

original: 'bras bu'i khyad par ni nyan thos rnams nyan thos kyi byang chub khong du chud pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dag kyang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub khong du chud par zad de /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i khyad par ni nyan thos rnams nyan thos kyi byang chub khong du chud pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dag kyang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub khong du chud par zad de /
translated: The difference in their results is that the disciples realize the enlightenment of the disciples and the hermit buddhas realize the enlightenment of the hermit buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob cing khong du chud pas na khyad zhugs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob cing khong du chud pas na khyad zhugs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas attain and realize the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: de la byang chub kyi rigs de ni thog mar byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs thams cad dang / sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi gzhi dang rten yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩ'di la byang chub sems dpa' dang po nyid du so so skye bo'i dus na /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi rigs de ni thog mar byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs thams cad dang / sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi gzhi dang rten yin par rig par bya'o // 'di la byang chub sems dpa' dang po nyid du so so skye bo'i dus na /
translated: The spiritual potential for enlightenment should be understood as the basis and support of the initial generation of the intention to achieve enlightenment, of all the elements that lead to enlightenment, of the spiritual levels and of the transcendences.

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang dag pa'i smon lam thams cad kyi gtso bo yin la /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang dag pa'i smon lam thams cad kyi gtso bo yin la /
translated: In this regard, the bodhisattva's initial generation of the intention to achieve enlightenment, while still an ordinary being, is the foremost of all the true aspirations of the disciples and hermit buddhas.

original: de phan chad kyi byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i smon lam thams cad kyang der 'dus shing bsdus pas na /
analyzed: de phan chad kyi byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa'i smon lam thams cad kyang der 'dus shing bsdus pas na /
translated: And all the bodhisattva's subsequent true aspirations are included in and subsumed under that initial aspiration.

original: dang po de yang dag pa'i smon lam gyi rang bzhin no //üîΩyang byang chub sems dpa' byang chub tu sems bskyed pa na /
analyzed: dang po de yang dag pa'i smon lam gyi rang bzhin no // yang byang chub sems dpa' byang chub tu sems bskyed pa na /
translated: Thus, that initial aspiration is the nature of true aspiration.

original: 'di ltar sems mngon bar 'du byed cing tshig tu yang 'byin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems mngon bar 'du byed cing tshig tu yang 'byin te /
translated: Moreover, when the bodhisattva generates the intention to achieve enlightenment, he does so with a mind that is fully oriented toward enlightenment and he also expresses it in words.

original: ae ma'o bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par byas la /üîΩsems can nyan thos kyi rigs can dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dag ni mthar thug pa'i mya ngan las 'das par gzhag /
analyzed: ae ma'o bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par byas la / sems can nyan thos kyi rigs can dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dag ni mthar thug pa'i mya ngan las 'das par gzhag /
translated: I will cause myself to be fully awakened to supreme and complete enlightenment,

original: theg pa chen po'i rigs can dag ni /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i rigs can dag ni /
translated: and I will establish those sentient beings who are of the Hearer lineage and those who are of the Solitary Realizer lineage in the ultimate nirvana,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la gzhag par bya'o @3b zhes sems skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la gzhag par bya'o @3b zhes sems skyed par byed do //
translated: and I will establish those who are of the Bodhisattva lineage in the knowledge of a Tathagata.

original: de bas na sems bskyed pa de 'dod pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na sems bskyed pa de 'dod pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Thus, the generation of the Thought has the aspect of desire.

original: sems bskyed ba de yang byang chub dang sems can gyi don la dmigs nas /
analyzed: sems bskyed ba de yang byang chub dang sems can gyi don la dmigs nas /
translated: Moreover, that generation of the Thought is generated by observing enlightenment and the welfare of sentient beings,

original: de gnyis 'dod pa'i phyir sems skyed par byed kyi /
analyzed: de gnyis 'dod pa'i phyir sems skyed par byed kyi /
translated: because it is the desire for those two.

original: mi dmigs bar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mi dmigs bar ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not generated without observing them.

original: de bas na sems bskyed pa de byang chub la dmigs pa dang / sems can gyi don la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na sems bskyed pa de byang chub la dmigs pa dang / sems can gyi don la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, that generation of the Thought is the observation of enlightenment and the observation of the welfare of sentient beings.

original: gzhan yang brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i phyir smon lam btab pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i phyir smon lam btab pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, among all the aspirations that are made in order to generate mundane roots of virtue, such as those of Sakra, Brahma, and so on, and the correct aspirations that are made in order to generate supramundane roots of virtue, such as those of sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and so on, this initial generation of the enlightenment mind is the supreme correct aspiration.

original: yang dag pa'i smon lam btab pa de dag thams cad kyi nang na dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa 'di yang dag pa'i smon lam gyi mchog yin pas bla na med pa ste de ltar na sems bskyed pa 'di'i rang bzhin dang / rnam pa dang /üîΩdmigs pa dang / mchog tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i smon lam btab pa de dag thams cad kyi nang na dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa 'di yang dag pa'i smon lam gyi mchog yin pas bla na med pa ste de ltar na sems bskyed pa 'di'i rang bzhin dang / rnam pa dang / dmigs pa dang / mchog tu gyur pa ste /
translated: Thus, the nature of this generation of the enlightenment mind, its aspect,

original: rnam pa bzhir rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhir rig par bya'o //
translated: its object, and its supremacy should be understood as fourfold.

original: yang sems bskyed pa de rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang sems bskyed pa de rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, this generation of the enlightenment mind should be understood as twofold:

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: its occurrence and nonoccurrence.

original: de la 'byung ba ni dang po sems bskyed nas shin tu de dag gi rjes su 'jug gi ldog par mi byed do //
analyzed: de la 'byung ba ni dang po sems bskyed nas shin tu de dag gi rjes su 'jug gi ldog par mi byed do //
translated: The first is one who, having generated the Thought, does not turn back from it, but follows it.

original: 'byung ba ma yin pa ni shin tu de dag gi rjes su 'jug pa ma yin gyi slar yang ldog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba ma yin pa ni shin tu de dag gi rjes su 'jug pa ma yin gyi slar yang ldog par byed pa'o //
translated: The second is one who does not follow it, but turns back from it.

original: sems bskyed nas ldog pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sems bskyed nas ldog pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: And that turning back from the Thought is of two kinds:

translated: The meaning of ‚Äútaught‚Äù should be applied to the words of explanation.

original: @7a * // cis brgyan zhe na /üîΩtshig dang rtsa ba dri ma med pa ste //
analyzed: @7a * // cis brgyan zhe na / tshig dang rtsa ba dri ma med pa ste //
translated: By what is it adorned?

original: zhes pa la /
analyzed: zhes pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe words and the root are stainless.‚Äù

original: rgyan gang gis brgyan zhe na /
analyzed: rgyan gang gis brgyan zhe na /
translated: By what ornament is it adorned?

original: tshig dri ma med cing bzang ba dang / rtsa ba dri ma med cing bzang bas brgyan te tshig dang rtsa ba bzang po ni rgyan yin no //
analyzed: tshig dri ma med cing bzang ba dang / rtsa ba dri ma med cing bzang bas brgyan te tshig dang rtsa ba bzang po ni rgyan yin no //
translated: It is adorned with pure, good words and pure, good roots. Good words and roots are ornaments.

original: tshig dri ma med pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshig dri ma med pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of pure words,

original: dri ma med ces bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba la sogs pa'o zhes pa la /
analyzed: dri ma med ces bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba la sogs pa'o zhes pa la /
translated: it is said that purity is going to the city of nirvana, etc.

original: tshig de mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba la sogs pa yan lag brgyad dang ldan pas na dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshig de mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba la sogs pa yan lag brgyad dang ldan pas na dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those words are called pure because they possess the eight branches of going to the city of nirvana, etc.

original: yan lag brgyad ni grong khyer du 'gro ba dang / stobs dang yon tan du ldan pa dang / rnam par bsal ba dang / rnam par shes pa dang / mnyan par 'os pa dang / mi brten pa dang / rab tu mi mthun pa med pa dang /üîΩmi zad pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag brgyad ni grong khyer du 'gro ba dang / stobs dang yon tan du ldan pa dang / rnam par bsal ba dang / rnam par shes pa dang / mnyan par 'os pa dang / mi brten pa dang / rab tu mi mthun pa med pa dang /üîΩmi zad pa'o //
translated: The eight branches are: going to the city, possessing strength and virtues, being well known, being understood, being worthy to be heard, being independent, being completely harmonious, and being inexhaustible.

original: tshig de mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i chos ston par byed pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i rgyu byed pas na grong khyer du 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshig de mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i chos ston par byed pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i rgyu byed pas na grong khyer du 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That word is called ‚Äúleading to the city‚Äù because it causes one to attain nirvana, which is the teaching of the Dharma that leads to nirvana.

original: tshig de mu stegs rnams 'joms pa'i stobs dang ldan pa dang / 'jam zhing snyan pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshig de mu stegs rnams 'joms pa'i stobs dang ldan pa dang / 'jam zhing snyan pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That word is called ‚Äúpowerful‚Äù because it conquers the heterodox, and it is called ‚Äúgentle and pleasant‚Äù because it has the quality of gentleness and pleasantness.

original: nges pa'i tshig dang yi ge mdzes pa dag 'byung bas rnam par gsal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig dang yi ge mdzes pa dag 'byung bas rnam par gsal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúclear‚Äù because it produces beautiful etymologies and letters.

original: tshig de mnyan pa'i dus na yang brda phrad par sla bas rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshig de mnyan pa'i dus na yang brda phrad par sla bas rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That word is called ‚Äúcognizable‚Äù because it is easy to understand when it is heard.

original: chos dang don du bcas pa ston pas mnyan par 'os pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos dang don du bcas pa ston pas mnyan par 'os pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúworthy of being heard‚Äù because it teaches the Dharma and its meaning.

original: khe dang bkur sti la ma chags pas mi brten pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khe dang bkur sti la ma chags pas mi brten pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúnot dependent‚Äù because it is not attached to gain and honor.

original: smra ba na yang dran pa dang dgos pa nyi tshe ba smra bas rab tu mi mthun pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smra ba na yang dran pa dang dgos pa nyi tshe ba smra bas rab tu mi mthun pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúnot disagreeable‚Äù because when it is spoken, it speaks with mindfulness and with a limited purpose.

original: spobs pa zhum pa med pa dang spobs pa zad mi shes pa'i thabs 'byung bas mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spobs pa zhum pa med pa dang spobs pa zad mi shes pa'i thabs 'byung bas mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called inexhaustible because it is the source of eloquence that is never timid and never exhausted.

original: de ltar yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i tshig de mdor na yon tan gsum dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i tshig de mdor na yon tan gsum dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, these eight limbs of speech are to be known in brief as endowed with three qualities.

original: yon tan gsum ni /
analyzed: yon tan gsum ni /
translated: The three qualities are:

original: dbang du byas pa dang / rang bzhin dang sbyor ba'o ;
analyzed: dbang du byas pa dang / rang bzhin dang sbyor ba'o ;
translated: the basis, the nature, and the application.

original: / de la grong khyer du 'gro zhes bya ba'i tshig gcig gi dbang du byas pa bstan te /
analyzed: / de la grong khyer du 'gro zhes bya ba'i tshig gcig gi dbang du byas pa bstan te /
translated: The basis is shown by the single phrase ‚Äúgoing to the city.‚Äù

original: tshig de mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig de mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This phrase is spoken with reference to the attainment of nirvana.

original: stobs dang yon tan du ldan pa dang / rnam par gsal ba gnyis kyis ni rang bzhin bstan to //
analyzed: stobs dang yon tan du ldan pa dang / rnam par gsal ba gnyis kyis ni rang bzhin bstan to //
translated: The nature is shown by the two qualities of being endowed with strength and being clear.

original: lhag ma @7b rnams kyis ni sbyor ba bstan te //
analyzed: lhag ma @7b rnams kyis ni sbyor ba bstan te //
translated: The application is shown by the remaining phrases.

original: rtsa ba dri ma med pa ji lta bu yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtsa ba dri ma med pa ji lta bu yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show what the stainless root is like, it is said:

original: dri ma med pa'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni tshig dang yi ger sbyor cing ldan pa la sogs pa rgya cher bya ste zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩtshig dang yi ger 'byor pa la sogs pa yan lag brgyad dang ldan pas na rtsa ba dri ma med ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni tshig dang yi ger sbyor cing ldan pa la sogs pa rgya cher bya ste zhes bya ba smos te / tshig dang yi ger 'byor pa la sogs pa yan lag brgyad dang ldan pas na rtsa ba dri ma med ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The root of stainlessness is the eight branches of the path of noble beings, beginning with right speech and right action.üîΩThe root of stainlessness is the eight branches of the path of noble beings, beginning with right speech and right action.üîΩThe eight branches are right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right concentration, right view, and right thought.

original: yan lag brgyad ni tshig dang yi ger 'byor pa dang bcas pa dang / lugs bzhin pa dang / rjes su bsal ba dang / so sor mthun pa dang / nye bar 'dren pa dang / gzung bar 'os ba dang / mkhas pa dang / rab tu byed pa'i yan lag gi tshogs so //
analyzed: yan lag brgyad ni tshig dang yi ger 'byor pa dang bcas pa dang / lugs bzhin pa dang / rjes su bsal ba dang / so sor mthun pa dang / nye bar 'dren pa dang / gzung bar 'os ba dang / mkhas pa dang / rab tu byed pa'i yan lag gi tshogs so //
translated: Right speech is speech that is not distorted by the faults of lying, divisive speech, harsh speech, or gossip.üîΩRight action is action that is not distorted by the faults of killing, stealing, or sexual misconduct.

original: de la tshig dang yi ge dang ming la sogs pa'i rim bzhin du steng 'og ma 'khrul par 'chad pas na tshig dang yi ger 'byor pa zhes bya'o //üîΩyang na 'byor pa zhes bya ba ni rigs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de la tshig dang yi ge dang ming la sogs pa'i rim bzhin du steng 'og ma 'khrul par 'chad pas na tshig dang yi ger 'byor pa zhes bya'o //üîΩyang na 'byor pa zhes bya ba ni rigs pa la bya ste /
translated: Right livelihood is livelihood that is not distorted by the faults of wrong livelihood, such as hypocrisy, flattery, hinting, and extortion.üîΩRight effort is effort that is not distorted by the faults of laziness, lack of mindfulness, lack of alertness, and lack of effort.üîΩRight mindfulness is mindfulness that is not distorted by the faults of forgetfulness, lack of mindfulness, lack of alertness, and lack of effort.üîΩRight concentration is concentration that is not distorted by the faults of laziness, lack of mindfulness, lack of alertness, and lack of effort.üîΩRight view is view that is not distorted by the faults of wrong view, doubt, and the view of the transitory collection.üîΩRight thought is thought that is not distorted by the faults of thoughts of desire, malice, and harming others.

original: bya ba sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa ste /
translated: The four principles are: the principle of efficacy, the principle of cause and effect, the principle of logical possibility, and the principle of reality.

original: rigs pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i tshig dang / yi ge ston pa'i phyir tshig dang yi ger 'byor pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rigs pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i tshig dang / yi ge ston pa'i phyir tshig dang yi ger 'byor pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called mastery of words and syllables because it teaches words and syllables endowed with the four principles.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa rnam pa gnyis yod pa las /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa rnam pa gnyis yod pa las /
translated: There are two kinds of things: those to be established and those that establish.

original: sgrub par byed pas bsgrub par bya ba grub par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ston te /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pas bsgrub par bya ba grub par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ston te /
translated: It shows the characteristic of the establishment of the probandum by the proof.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa 'brel pa 'chad bas na bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa 'brel pa 'chad bas na bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called connected because the probandum and the proof are connected.

original: bshad pa'i tshig rnams kyang sngar bshad par bya ba'i tshig phyis mi smra /
analyzed: bshad pa'i tshig rnams kyang sngar bshad par bya ba'i tshig phyis mi smra /
translated: The words of the explanation are such that the words to be explained earlier are not spoken later,

original: phyis smra bar bya ba'i tshig sngar mi smra ste /
analyzed: phyis smra bar bya ba'i tshig sngar mi smra ste /
translated: and the words to be spoken later are not spoken earlier.

original: bshad pa'i tshig rnams steng 'og 'brel par rim bzhin du 'chad bas na lugs bzhin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bshad pa'i tshig rnams steng 'og 'brel par rim bzhin du 'chad bas na lugs bzhin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called in accordance with the rules because the words of the explanation are spoken in a sequence that is connected, with the earlier and later words being mutually connected.

original: tshig dang yi ge thams cad kyang brda phrad par sla ba gsal ba dag ston pas na rjes su gsal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge thams cad kyang brda phrad par sla ba gsal ba dag ston pas na rjes su gsal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since all the words and letters are easy to understand and clearly taught, it is called ‚Äúclear.‚Äù

original: nyan thos kyi rigs can gyi gang zag la yang nyan thos kyi theg pa'i chos ston /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi rigs can gyi gang zag la yang nyan thos kyi theg pa'i chos ston /
translated: To those individuals who are of the ≈õrƒÅvaka type, he teaches the Dharma of the ≈örƒÅvakayƒÅna.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can gyi gang zag la yang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i chos ston /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can gyi gang zag la yang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i chos ston /
translated: To those individuals who are of the pratyekabuddha type, he teaches the Dharma of the Pratyeka¬≠buddha¬≠yƒÅna.

original: theg pa chen po'i rigs can gyi gang zag la yang theg pa chen po'i chos ston te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i rigs can gyi gang zag la yang theg pa chen po'i chos ston te /
translated: To those individuals who are of the MahƒÅyƒÅna type, he teaches the Dharma of the MahƒÅyƒÅna.

original: 'khor ji lta ba bzhin du 'khor dang mthun pa kho nar ston pas na so sor mthun pa zhes bya'o //üîΩtshig rnams @8a * //
analyzed: 'khor ji lta ba bzhin du 'khor dang mthun pa kho nar ston pas na so sor mthun pa zhes bya'o // tshig rnams @8a * //
translated: Since he teaches in accordance with the retinue, in a way that is appropriate for the retinue, it is called ‚Äúappropriate.‚Äù

original: kyang yid du 'ong zhing yid sim pa dang / snying dga' bar 'gyur ba sha stag ston pas na nye bar 'dren pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kyang yid du 'ong zhing yid sim pa dang / snying dga' bar 'gyur ba sha stag ston pas na nye bar 'dren pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since he teaches only words that are pleasing to the mind, that satisfy the mind, and that gladden the heart, it is called ‚Äúattractive.‚Äù

original: chos bshad pa'i dus bzhin du ston pa dang / chos dang don du bcas par ston pas na gzung bar 'os pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos bshad pa'i dus bzhin du ston pa dang / chos dang don du bcas par ston pas na gzung bar 'os pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is worthy of being taken up because it is taught in the same way as the Dharma is explained, and because it is taught together with the Dharma and its meaning.

original: mkhas pa dang rtag tu byed pa'i yan lag ces pa la /
analyzed: mkhas pa dang rtag tu byed pa'i yan lag ces pa la /
translated: The branches of skill and constant practice.

original: mkhas par byed pa dang rtag tu byed pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: mkhas par byed pa dang rtag tu byed pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Skill and constant practice should be applied.

original: slob ma rnams chos kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas par byed pa dang / chos rgyun du ston par byed pa'i phyir mkhas pa dang rtag tu byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: slob ma rnams chos kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas par byed pa dang / chos rgyun du ston par byed pa'i phyir mkhas pa dang rtag tu byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called skill and constant practice because it makes disciples skilled in the characteristics of phenomena and because it constantly teaches the Dharma.

original: de'i yan lag ni yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad do //
analyzed: de'i yan lag ni yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad do //
translated: Its branches are the eightfold noble path of right view and so on.

original: de lta bu'i chos dga' 'chad pas na mkhas pa dang rtag tu byed pa'i yan lag gi tshogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos dga' 'chad pas na mkhas pa dang rtag tu byed pa'i yan lag gi tshogs zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it explains the Dharma that is like that, it is called the collection of the branches of skill and constant practice.

original: theg pa chen po'i chos rnams la rin po che la sogs pas brgyan du mi rung snyam pa la /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos rnams la rin po che la sogs pas brgyan du mi rung snyam pa la /
translated: One might think that the teachings of the Great Vehicle are not suitable to be adorned with jewels and so on.

original: mi rung ba bstan pa'i phyir gang gi phyir tshig dang rtsa ba dang / yi ge med par don bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes ston te /
analyzed: mi rung ba bstan pa'i phyir gang gi phyir tshig dang rtsa ba dang / yi ge med par don bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes ston te /
translated: In order to show that this is not possible, he says, because the meaning cannot be taught without words, roots, and letters.

original: tshig bzang po dang rtsa ba bzang po dang / yi ge bzang po med par theg pa chen po'i don bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: tshig bzang po dang rtsa ba bzang po dang / yi ge bzang po med par theg pa chen po'i don bstan par mi nus te /
translated: The meaning of the Great Vehicle cannot be taught without good words, good roots, and good letters.

original: theg pa chen po'i don bstan pa yang tshig dang rtsa ba dang yi ge bzang pos ston par byed do //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i don bstan pa yang tshig dang rtsa ba dang yi ge bzang pos ston par byed do //
translated: The meaning of the Great Vehicle is taught by means of good words, good roots, and good letters.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sdug bsngal bsgral ba'i phyir ro zhes pa la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsgral ba'i phyir ro zhes pa la /
translated: In order to liberate from suffering.

original: gang gi phyir brgyan par byed ce na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir brgyan par byed ce na /
translated: Why is it adorned?

original: khams gsum gyi sems can skye rga na 'chi la sogs pas sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir brgyan par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi sems can skye rga na 'chi la sogs pas sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir brgyan par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is adorned in order to remove the suffering of beings in the three realms who are suffering from birth, aging, sickness, death, and so on. This is the meaning.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: zhes bya ba ni /üîΩci'i phyir brgyan par byed /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni / ci'i phyir brgyan par byed /
translated: This is said.üîΩWhy is it adorned?

original: rgyu gang gis brgyan par byed /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis brgyan par byed /
translated: By what cause is it adorned?

original: rgyu gang las rgyan de byung zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu gang las rgyan de byung zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is the cause from which that ornament arises?

original: gang gi phyir sdug bsngal ba'i 'gro ba la snying rje ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sdug bsngal ba'i 'gro ba la snying rje ste /
translated: Because of compassion for the suffering world.

original: de bas na snying rje ba'i phyir ro zhes pa la gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams sdug bsngal gyis nyen pa'i 'gro ba la snying rje ste /
analyzed: de bas na snying rje ba'i phyir ro zhes pa la gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams sdug bsngal gyis nyen pa'i 'gro ba la snying rje ste /
translated: Therefore, because of compassion, because the bodhisattvas have compassion for the world which is tormented by suffering,

original: de bas na snying rje dang ldan pa'i rgyus brgyan par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩbdag nyid ces bya ba ni snying rje'i bdag nyid de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bas na snying rje dang ldan pa'i rgyus brgyan par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // bdag nyid ces bya ba ni snying rje'i bdag nyid de zhes bya ba la /
translated: therefore, because of the cause of compassion, they are adorned, is the sense.üîΩThe word themselves means because of their very nature of compassion.

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni snying rje'i bdag nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni snying rje'i bdag nyid la bya ste /
translated: The word themselves refers to their very nature of compassion,

original: byang @8b chub sems dpa' rnams ni snying rje dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang @8b chub sems dpa' rnams ni snying rje dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because the bodhisattvas are by nature compassionate, is the sense.

original: ci'i rgyan du byed ce na zhes pa ni theg pa gsum las theg pa gang gi rgyan du byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci'i rgyan du byed ce na zhes pa ni theg pa gsum las theg pa gang gi rgyan du byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is it an ornament of? It is an ornament of the vehicle, of which vehicle? Of the three vehicles.

original: theg pa dam pa'i rnam pa bstan pa chos gang la yod pa chos de'i'o zhes pa la chos de'i gzhung dang mdo sde gang las theg pa dam pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa dam pa'i rnam pa bstan pa chos gang la yod pa chos de'i'o zhes pa la chos de'i gzhung dang mdo sde gang las theg pa dam pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The ornament of that Dharma is the ornament of that scripture, that sutra, which has the character of the excellent vehicle,

original: theg pa chen po'i chos kyi rang bzhin thabs dang shes rab kyi mtshan nyid chos gang las byung ba'i chos de'i rgyan du byed kyi /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos kyi rang bzhin thabs dang shes rab kyi mtshan nyid chos gang las byung ba'i chos de'i rgyan du byed kyi /
translated: the nature of the Dharma of the Great Vehicle, the character of means and insight.

original: theg pa chung du'i chos kyi rgyan du byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: theg pa chung du'i chos kyi rgyan du byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not the ornament of the Dharma of the Lesser Vehicle.

original: su dag gi phyir brgyan zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: su dag gi phyir brgyan zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For whose sake is it an ornament?üîΩFor the person of the Sravaka type, for the person of the Pratyekabuddha type, and for the person of the Mahayana type.

original: nyan thos kyi rigs can gyi gang zag dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can gyi gang zag dang / theg pa chen po'i rigs can gyi gang zag las gang gi don du brgyan bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi rigs can gyi gang zag dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can gyi gang zag dang / theg pa chen po'i rigs can gyi gang zag las gang gi don du brgyan bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: For whose sake is it an ornament?üîΩTherefore, it is for the sake of the beings of the world.

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba'i sems can gyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de'i sgra theg pa chen po dang sbyar te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba'i sems can gyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de'i sgra theg pa chen po dang sbyar te /
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù is connected with the Great Vehicle.

original: theg pa chen po de rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'i sems can rnams kyi don dang ched du brgyan par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: theg pa chen po de rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'i sems can rnams kyi don dang ched du brgyan par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is an ornament for the sake of, i.e. for the purpose of, those beings who have set out to realize the universal vehicle.üîΩIt is a seven-fold metaphor.

original: de ni mtshan ma bdun pa ste zhes bya bas de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i sgra sgra'i gtsug lag gi mtshan nyid dang sbyar na /
analyzed: de ni mtshan ma bdun pa ste zhes bya bas de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i sgra sgra'i gtsug lag gi mtshan nyid dang sbyar na /
translated: The word hi in the verse is to be construed with the word lak·π£a·πáa in the prose commentary.

original: mtshan ma bdun pa zhes bya ste /üîΩmtshan ma bdun pa'i don ni de'i phyir ram de'i don du'am /
analyzed: mtshan ma bdun pa zhes bya ste / mtshan ma bdun pa'i don ni de'i phyir ram de'i don du'am /
translated: It is a seven-fold metaphor.

original: de'i don du zhes bya ba'i tshul du 'dren no //üîΩrgyan rnam pa du mas brgyan zhe na zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i chos dang don la brgyan na /
analyzed: de'i don du zhes bya ba'i tshul du 'dren no // rgyan rnam pa du mas brgyan zhe na zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i chos dang don la brgyan na /
translated: The meaning of a seven-fold metaphor is to be interpreted in the manner of a purpose, i.e. for the sake of, for the purpose of, or for the benefit of.üîΩHow many kinds of ornament does it have?

original: rgyan gyi grangs du zhig gis brgyan par byed ce na zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: rgyan gyi grangs du zhig gis brgyan par byed ce na zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: If the universal vehicle is an ornament of the Dharma and its meaning, how many kinds of ornament does it have?

original: de yang chos lngas brgyan par byed do //
analyzed: de yang chos lngas brgyan par byed do //
translated: It is an ornament through five dharmas.

original: 'byor pa ni ldan pa'o zhes pa la yi ge dang tshig tu 'brel pa dang / tshig dang don du 'brel pa la bya'o //
analyzed: 'byor pa ni ldan pa'o zhes pa la yi ge dang tshig tu 'brel pa dang / tshig dang don du 'brel pa la bya'o //
translated: Prosperity is to be endowed with it. It is to be connected with letters and words, and to be connected with words and meanings.üîΩUnsurpassed is to be in the unsurpassed vehicle.

original: bla med ni bla na med pa'i theg par song ba la bya'o zhes bya ba la bla na med par song ba zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i theg par song ba la bya ste /
analyzed: bla med ni bla na med pa'i theg par song ba la bya'o zhes bya ba la bla na med par song ba zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i theg par song ba la bya ste /
translated: In the sense of gone to the unsurpassed, it is to be in the unsurpassed vehicle.

original: don du na theg pa chen por gtogs pa'i chos lnga bstan pa'i sgo nas brgyan par byed ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: don du na theg pa chen por gtogs pa'i chos lnga bstan pa'i sgo nas brgyan par byed ces pa'i don to //
translated: In reality, it is to be adorned through teaching the five dharmas belonging to the Great Vehicle. This is the meaning.

original: da ni don gyi tshul lnga'i rang bzhin de dag tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: da ni don gyi tshul lnga'i rang bzhin de dag tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to zhes bya ba la /
translated: Now, those natures of the five topics are taught in two verses.

original: gong du rgyan dus brgyan zhes bya ba @9a * //
analyzed: gong du rgyan dus brgyan zhes bya ba @9a * //
translated: Above, it was said, Adorned with ornaments,

original: la ; chos rnam pa lnga bstan pas brgyan to zhes de skad du glengs pa la /
analyzed: la ; chos rnam pa lnga bstan pas brgyan to zhes de skad du glengs pa la /
translated: and Adorned through teaching the five kinds of dharmas.

original: da ni tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pos chos lnga po de dag gang dang gang yin pa ston to //
analyzed: da ni tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pos chos lnga po de dag gang dang gang yin pa ston to //
translated: Now, in two verses, it is taught what those five dharmas are.

original: de la theg pa chen po'i chos rnams ni don rnam pa lnga'i dbang du byas nas bshad de /
analyzed: de la theg pa chen po'i chos rnams ni don rnam pa lnga'i dbang du byas nas bshad de /
translated: The teachings of the Great Vehicle are explained in terms of five topics.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang / shes par bya ba dang / bsam pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par thugs su chud pa'i don so so rang gis rig pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang / shes par bya ba dang / bsam pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par thugs su chud pa'i don so so rang gis rig pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The topics to be accomplished, the topics to be understood, the topics to be reflected on, the inconceivable topics, and the topics to be fully comprehended by personal experience, which have the nature of the elements that lead to enlightenment.

original: chos de lnga'i 'grel pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: chos de lnga'i 'grel pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The commentary on these five topics has three parts:

original: theg pa chen po'i dngos po lnga dang / rang bzhin gsum dang / gang zag rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i dngos po lnga dang / rang bzhin gsum dang / gang zag rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: the five topics of the Great Vehicle, the three natures, and the presentation of the person.

original: de la theg pa chen po'i dngos po lnga ni /
analyzed: de la theg pa chen po'i dngos po lnga ni /
translated: The five topics of the Great Vehicle are

original: ming dang / mtshan ma dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: ming dang / mtshan ma dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: names, signs, conceptions, suchness, and nonconceptual exalted wisdom.

original: de la ming zhes bya ba ni brda dang tha snyad dang / mngon par brjod pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de la ming zhes bya ba ni brda dang tha snyad dang / mngon par brjod pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: A name is the nature of a conventional symbol and verbalization.

original: 'jig rten pa gang ming gi sgo nas phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i chos rnams la mngon bar zhen to //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa gang ming gi sgo nas phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i chos rnams la mngon bar zhen to //
translated: The worldly person, by means of names, adheres to the aggregates, elements, etc., as real things.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: ji ltar ming gang dang gang gis chos gang dang gang dag la mngon bar brjod cing btags pa de bzhin du chos de dag rang bzhin gyis yod do zhes chags so //
analyzed: ji ltar ming gang dang gang gis chos gang dang gang dag la mngon bar brjod cing btags pa de bzhin du chos de dag rang bzhin gyis yod do zhes chags so //
translated: Whatever names there are, by those names whatever things there are are expressed and designated. Just so, those things exist by intrinsic reality.

original: de la ming gis brjod pa'i chos de dag ni ming dang chos su bcas te med pa yin no //
analyzed: de la ming gis brjod pa'i chos de dag ni ming dang chos su bcas te med pa yin no //
translated: But those things expressed by names, together with the names, do not exist.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: Therefore the Lord Buddha has said:

original: ming ni gang dang gang dag gis //
analyzed: ming ni gang dang gang dag gis //
translated: Whatever names there are

original: chos ni gang dang gang brjod pa //
analyzed: chos ni gang dang gang brjod pa //
translated: By which things are expressed,

original: de ni de na med pa ste //
analyzed: de ni de na med pa ste //
translated: They do not exist there;

original: de ni chos kyi chos nyid do //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni chos kyi chos nyid do // zhes gsungs so //
translated: That is the reality of things.

original: de ltar 'jig rten pa'i ming gi sgo nas chos rnams la yod par mngon par zhen pa dag la /
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten pa'i ming gi sgo nas chos rnams la yod par mngon par zhen pa dag la /
translated: Thus, in regard to the things to which the worldly person adheres as existent by means of names,

original: gang ming gis brjod pa'i chos de dag ni rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar bya ba dka' bas na de ni gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang ming gis brjod pa'i chos de dag ni rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar bya ba dka' bas na de ni gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the above is that the phenomena expressed by names do not exist by intrinsic reality.

original: de dang chos 'dra ba'i dpe ni /
analyzed: de dang chos 'dra ba'i dpe ni /
translated: The example that is similar to that is

original: gser las brdungs byas 'dra zhing zhes bya ba la 'di ltar mgar ba mkhas pas brdungs pa dang bsregs pa dang / sbyangs pa la sogs pa'i 'bad pa dang rtsol ba chan pos las su rung bar byas te /
analyzed: gser las brdungs byas 'dra zhing zhes bya ba la 'di ltar mgar ba mkhas pas brdungs pa dang bsregs pa dang / sbyangs pa la sogs pa'i 'bad pa dang rtsol ba chan pos las su rung bar byas te /
translated: ‚Äúlike gold that is worked on.‚Äù In this way, a skilled smith, through great effort and exertion in working, burning, and polishing, makes it workable.

original: rna cha dang dpung rgyan la sogs pa'i rgyan du bsgrubs nas mdzes par brgyan na dga' @9b ba'i mchog bskyed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rna cha dang dpung rgyan la sogs pa'i rgyan du bsgrubs nas mdzes par brgyan na dga' @9b ba'i mchog bskyed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Having made it into ornaments such as earrings and bracelets, when it is used to make beautiful adornments, it generates the highest joy.

original: theg pa chen po 'di la yang ming gis dngos po 'di la mngon par chags pa rnams la ming gang gis brjod pa'i dngos po de dag rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin no zhes gtan tshigs kyis rang gi phyogs bsgrub pa dang gzhan gyi phyogs su ni
analyzed: theg pa chen po 'di la yang ming gis dngos po 'di la mngon par chags pa rnams la ming gang gis brjod pa'i dngos po de dag rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin no zhes gtan tshigs kyis rang gi phyogs bsgrub pa dang gzhan gyi phyogs su ni
translated: In this Mahayana, those who are attached to things by way of names are established in their own position by reasoning, ‚ÄúThe things expressed by those names do not intrinsically exist.‚Äù

original: dbyung ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas med par bsgrubs na /
analyzed: dbyung ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas med par bsgrubs na /
translated: And when the position of others is refuted by way of consequences and so on,

original: gser las brdungs su byas pa bzhin du dga' ba'i mchog skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gser las brdungs su byas pa bzhin du dga' ba'i mchog skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: the highest joy arises, like that from beating gold.

original: bsgrub par bya ba smras zin to //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba smras zin to //
translated: The probandum has already been stated.

original: mtshan ma ni mngon par brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi ming de nyid kyi dngos po rten du gyur pa sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa phyi'i gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin gzung ba'i cha la bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma ni mngon par brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi ming de nyid kyi dngos po rten du gyur pa sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa phyi'i gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin gzung ba'i cha la bya ste /
translated: Signs are the dependent nature that is the basis of the name, which is the nature of expressions. They are the apprehended aspect, such as seeds and sprouts.

original: phyi'i dngos po gang la brten nas ming rnam pa sna tshogs 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir gzhan dbang la mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyi'i dngos po gang la brten nas ming rnam pa sna tshogs 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir gzhan dbang la mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called dependent because various names are applied to them.

original: dngos po de yang rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i rang gi sems las snang ba tsam du zad pa bum pa dang snam bu la sogs par 'jig rten rang gis rig pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po de yang rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i rang gi sems las snang ba tsam du zad pa bum pa dang snam bu la sogs par 'jig rten rang gis rig pa ste /
translated: Moreover, that entity is merely an appearance from one's own mind, which is dependently arisen. The world knows that it is merely an appearance from one's own mind, such as a pot, a cloth, and so on.

original: de ni rten 'brel yin no zhes bstan nas shes par bya ba tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de ni rten 'brel yin no zhes bstan nas shes par bya ba tsam du zad do //
translated: Having taught that it is dependently arisen, it is merely to be known.

original: ji ltar zhe na phyi'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba de mngon sum du gyur te /üîΩrang gis rig pas na mngon sum du snang ba de la 'jig rten pa rnams gcig tu the tshom skye zhing yid gnyis zab med pas na sa bon las myu gu /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na phyi'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba de mngon sum du gyur te / rang gis rig pas na mngon sum du snang ba de la 'jig rten pa rnams gcig tu the tshom skye zhing yid gnyis zab med pas na sa bon las myu gu /
translated: How is that? That external dependent origination is directly perceived.

original: myu gu las 'dab ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas shes par bya ba tsam du zad do //
analyzed: myu gu las 'dab ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas shes par bya ba tsam du zad do //
translated: Since it is known by oneself, the world has no doubt or uncertainty about that which appears directly. Therefore, it is merely to be known through such statements as ‚Äúfrom a seed, a sprout,‚Äù ‚Äúfrom a sprout, a leaf,‚Äù and so on.

original: de dang chos 'dra ba'i dpe ni padmo rgyas pa bzhin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dang chos 'dra ba'i dpe ni padmo rgyas pa bzhin zhes bya ste /
translated: The example that is similar to that is ‚Äúlike an opened lotus.‚Äù

original: ji ltar nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis kha bye ba'i padma kha bye ba mthong na dga' ba'i mchog skya ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis kha bye ba'i padma kha bye ba mthong na dga' ba'i mchog skya ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as when one sees an opened lotus opened by the sun's rays, one experiences supreme joy,

original: phyi'i dngos po rnams rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba yin par 'bad rtsol chen po med pas bstan te /
analyzed: phyi'i dngos po rnams rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba yin par 'bad rtsol chen po med pas bstan te /
translated: The external things are shown to be dependently arisen without great effort.

original: shes par gyur na dga' ba'i mchog skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes par gyur na dga' ba'i mchog skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: When one understands that, the highest joy arises.

original: shes par bya ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: shes par bya ba bshad zin to //
translated: The object of knowledge has been explained.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa ni rten cing 'bral te 'byung ba de nyid dngos po tsam du sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i char gyur pa'i nang gi rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba la bya'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa ni rten cing 'bral te 'byung ba de nyid dngos po tsam du sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i char gyur pa'i nang gi rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba la bya'o //
translated: Imagination is the internal dependent origination, which is the part that apprehends the mere thing of that dependent origination as the nature of mind and mental factors.

original: de la ni theg pa chen po'i chos nyan pa dang / bsam pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas tshul bzhin du rnam par rtog pas phyi'i yul rnams ni sems las byung ba yin no zhes de ltar bsam par @10a * //
analyzed: de la ni theg pa chen po'i chos nyan pa dang / bsam pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas tshul bzhin du rnam par rtog pas phyi'i yul rnams ni sems las byung ba yin no zhes de ltar bsam par @10a * //
translated: With regard to that, one should think, ‚ÄúThe external objects are arisen from the mind,‚Äù by means of listening to the MahƒÅyƒÅna Dharma and by means of proper imagination through reflection and so on.

original: bya'o // ji ltar mngon pa'i chos bsdus pa las /
analyzed: bya'o // ji ltar mngon pa'i chos bsdus pa las /
translated: As it says in the Compendium of Abhidharma:

original: chos la rab tu zhugs pa'i chos rnams la dpyod pa ni rigs pa dus dpyod par byed ce na /
analyzed: chos la rab tu zhugs pa'i chos rnams la dpyod pa ni rigs pa dus dpyod par byed ce na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen one who has entered the Dharma analyzes the dharmas, how does one analyze the reasoning of the time?‚Äù

original: rigs pa bzhis dpyod par byed de /
analyzed: rigs pa bzhis dpyod par byed de /
translated: One should investigate with four reasonings.

original: rigs pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: rigs pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four reasonings are:

original: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang ; gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid sgrub pa'i rigs pa'o //
analyzed: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang ; gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid sgrub pa'i rigs pa'o //
translated: the reasoning of dependence, the reasoning of performance of function, the reasoning of proof by evidence, and the reasoning of nature.

original: da ltar rigs pa bzhis phyi'i dngos po rnams ni sems las snang ba yin no zhes tshul bzhin du rnam par brtags te bsams na kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang rnam par byang ba skye ba dang rjes su mthun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar rigs pa bzhis phyi'i dngos po rnams ni sems las snang ba yin no zhes tshul bzhin du rnam par brtags te bsams na kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang rnam par byang ba skye ba dang rjes su mthun par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one properly analyzes and reflects on external things with these four reasonings, one will be in accord with the arising of the abandonment of afflictions and the arising of purification.

original: de dang chos mthun pa'i dpe ni /
analyzed: de dang chos mthun pa'i dpe ni /
translated: The example that is similar to that is:

original: bkres pas nyen pa g-yos legs kha zas za ba 'dra //üîΩzhes bya ste /
analyzed: bkres pas nyen pa g-yos legs kha zas za ba 'dra // zhes bya ste /
translated: Like a hungry person eating well-prepared food.

original: ji ltar kha zas legs par g-yos pa'i kha dog dang dri dang ro la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar kha zas legs par g-yos pa'i kha dog dang dri dang ro la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: Just as well-prepared food has the perfect color, smell, taste, and so on,

original: bkres pas nyen pa'i gang zag gis zos na dga' ba'i mchog skye ba de bzhin du theg pa chen po'i chos bdud rtsi'i zas dang 'dra ba 'di la yang sngon dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / bsam pa la sogs pa ma byas pas bkres par gyur pa rnams kyis mnyan pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas tshul bzhin yid la byed pas bsams te zos na don rtogs pas tshim pa thob na dga' ba'i mchog skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bkres pas nyen pa'i gang zag gis zos na dga' ba'i mchog skye ba de bzhin du theg pa chen po'i chos bdud rtsi'i zas dang 'dra ba 'di la yang sngon dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / bsam pa la sogs pa ma byas pas bkres par gyur pa rnams kyis mnyan pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas tshul bzhin yid la byed pas bsams te zos na don rtogs pas tshim pa thob na dga' ba'i mchog skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Just as a person tormented by hunger would experience supreme joy if he ate it, in the same way, when those who have become hungry by not previously listening to the holy Dharma, reflecting on it, etc., properly contemplate this Dharma of the Great Vehicle, which is like the food of nectar, by listening to it, reflecting on it, etc., and then eat it, they experience supreme joy when they obtain satisfaction through understanding the meaning.

original: bsam pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: bsam pa bshad zin to //
translated: The intention has been explained.

original: de bzhin nyid ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Suchness is called inconceivable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: so so'i skye bos bsam pa'i spyod yul las 'das pa dang / 'phags pa rnams kyis so so rang gis rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so'i skye bos bsam pa'i spyod yul las 'das pa dang / 'phags pa rnams kyis so so rang gis rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is beyond the range of thought of ordinary beings and because it is to be personally experienced by the ƒÅryas.

original: de yang theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i bstan bcos las chos kyi sku ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de yang theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i bstan bcos las chos kyi sku ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: The dharmakƒÅya has the characteristic of being inconceivable.

original: de ltar na de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa ni so so rang gis rig pa yin pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten na de dang 'dra ba'i dpe med pa dang / rtog ge'i spyod yul las 'das pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa ni so so rang gis rig pa yin pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten na de dang 'dra ba'i dpe med pa dang / rtog ge'i spyod yul las 'das pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: Thus, since suchness is pure, it is to be personally experienced, it has no example in the world that is similar to it, and it is beyond the domain of speculation, so it is inconceivable.

original: 'di ni nyes pa dang po'o //

analyzed: legs par gsungs la rab smad pas //

analyzed: brlag 'gyur zhes bya ba ni med ces bya ba sgra ji bzhin du gzung ste /

analyzed: gzhan ma yin no zhes theg pa chen po sangs rgyas kyi tshig tu bsgrubs so //
translated: Thus, after teaching that, he proves that the Mahayana is the word of the Buddha, saying, ‚ÄúThis is the Mahayana, not another, ‚Äù to those who have wrongly engaged it, thinking, ‚ÄúIf this Mahayana is not the word of the Buddha, how could it have good qualities?‚Äù

original: de ltar theg pa chen po bsgrubs pa dang / the tshom du gyur pa dang / mi shes pa'i gang zag rnams dga' ba dang ma gu ba'i khyad par thob nas theg pa chen po 'di nyid 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i lam yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes de dag sangs rgyas par 'gyur ba'i thabs tshol bar byed de rim pa gang
analyzed: de ltar theg pa chen po bsgrubs pa dang / the tshom du gyur pa dang / mi shes pa'i gang zag rnams dga' ba dang ma gu ba'i khyad par thob nas theg pa chen po 'di nyid 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i lam yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes de dag sangs rgyas par 'gyur ba'i thabs tshol bar byed de rim pa gang
translated: Thus, those who practice the Great Vehicle, those who have doubts, and those who are ignorant will obtain the distinction of joy and faith and will become buddhas through this Great Vehicle itself, not through any other path.

original: gis 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i rim pa ston te /üîΩde yang theg pa chen po bstan pa'i tshul gyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su song ba'i rim pas /
analyzed: gis 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i rim pa ston te / de yang theg pa chen po bstan pa'i tshul gyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su song ba'i rim pas /
translated: They seek the method for becoming a buddha and demonstrate the stages by which one becomes a buddha.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub btsal dgos pas na /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub btsal dgos pas na /
translated: Moreover, through the method of teaching the Great Vehicle, one should seek unsurpassed enlightenment by going for refuge to the Three Jewels, such as the Buddha.

original: da skyabs su 'gro ba'i dbang du byas nas chos la ji ltar 'jug pa bstan te /
analyzed: da skyabs su 'gro ba'i dbang du byas nas chos la ji ltar 'jug pa bstan te /
translated: Therefore, now, from the perspective of going for refuge, the treatise demonstrates how to enter the Dharma.

original: theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis skyabs su song ba ni bdag dang gzhan bde ba phun sum tshogs pa thob pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis skyabs su song ba ni bdag dang gzhan bde ba phun sum tshogs pa thob pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Taking refuge in the Mahayana way is the cause for attaining the perfect bliss of oneself and others.

original: kun tu song dang khas blangs rtogs dang zil gyis gnon //
analyzed: kun tu song dang khas blangs rtogs dang zil gyis gnon //
translated: It is all-pervading, accepted, realized, and overpowering.

original: dbye ba'i rang bzhin rnam bzhi'i don gyi khyad par ston //
analyzed: dbye ba'i rang bzhin rnam bzhi'i don gyi khyad par ston //
translated: It teaches the special significance of the fourfold nature of classification.

original: theg chen mchog phyir dkon mchog rnams la skyabs song bas //üîΩde nyid skyabs su song ba'i mchog tu rig par bya //
analyzed: theg chen mchog phyir dkon mchog rnams la skyabs song bas // de nyid skyabs su song ba'i mchog tu rig par bya //

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩsems bskyed pa'i rang bzhin rnam pa bzhir dbye ba'i don gyi khyad par gyis na theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dkon mchog gsum la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / sems bskyed pa'i rang bzhin rnam pa bzhir dbye ba'i don gyi khyad par gyis na theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dkon mchog gsum la /
translated: This is to be known as the supreme taking of refuge.üîΩHere, the special significance of the fourfold nature of classification of the generation of the mind of enlightenment is that, by means of the Mahayana way, the bodhisattvas have taken refuge in the Three Jewels, the Buddha, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams skyabs su song ba de 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i skyabs su song ba las khyad par rnam pa bzhis khyad zhugs pas na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams skyabs su song ba de 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i skyabs su song ba las khyad par rnam pa bzhis khyad zhugs pas na /
translated: This is distinguished by four special features from the worldly and transcendent refuges.

original: skyabs su song ba gzhan pas mchog tu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skyabs su song ba gzhan pas mchog tu rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the going for refuge of the bodhisattva is superior to that of others.

original: khyad par rnam pa bzhi ni kun du song ba'i khyad par dang / khas blangs pa'i khyad par dang / rtogs pa'i khyad par dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: khyad par rnam pa bzhi ni kun du song ba'i khyad par dang / khas blangs pa'i khyad par dang / rtogs pa'i khyad par dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The superiority is of four kinds: universal, aspirational, realization, and overwhelming.

original: de la sems can thams cad bsgral bar bya ba'i phyir zhugs pas na kun du 'gro ba khyad zhugs so //
analyzed: de la sems can thams cad bsgral bar bya ba'i phyir zhugs pas na kun du 'gro ba khyad zhugs so //
translated: The universal superiority is that the bodhisattva has entered the path for the sake of liberating all sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya'o zhes khas len pas na khas len pa khyad zhugs so //üîΩbdag med pa nyid rtogs pas na rtogs @32a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya'o zhes khas len pas na khas len pa khyad zhugs so // bdag med pa nyid rtogs pas na rtogs @32a * //

original: pa khyad zhugs so //
analyzed: pa khyad zhugs so //
translated: The realization superiority is that the bodhisattva realizes selflessness.

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed phan chad brgya byin la sogs pa 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad zil gyis gnon pas na zil gyis gnon pa khyad zhugs te /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed phan chad brgya byin la sogs pa 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad zil gyis gnon pas na zil gyis gnon pa khyad zhugs te /
translated: The overwhelming superiority is that from the time of generating the enlightenment mind onward, the bodhisattva overwhelms all mundane beings such as ≈öakra and all supramundane beings such as the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: bzhi po 'di ni don zhib tu ni 'og nas 'chad do //
analyzed: bzhi po 'di ni don zhib tu ni 'og nas 'chad do //
translated: These four will be explained in detail below.

original: de ltar skyabs su 'gro ba rnams kyi mchog 'di dka' ba mang pos bsgrub dgos na la la ni mi spro ba yod de skyabs su 'gro bar bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar skyabs su 'gro ba rnams kyi mchog 'di dka' ba mang pos bsgrub dgos na la la ni mi spro ba yod de skyabs su 'gro bar bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Some people are reluctant to take refuge, thinking that it is difficult to do so, since it requires the accomplishment of many things.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams bdag bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su bsgral bar bya ba'i phyir theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su song ste /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams bdag bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su bsgral bar bya ba'i phyir theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su song ste /
translated: Thus, in order to attain unsurpassable enlightenment themselves and to liberate all sentient beings, bodhisattvas take refuge in the Three Jewels in the manner of the Great Vehicle.

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa phan chad bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa btang dgos pa bsgrub dka' ste /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa phan chad bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa btang dgos pa bsgrub dka' ste /
translated: From the time they arouse the bodhicitta, they have to accomplish the difficult task of giving away their heads, legs, and arms for three measureless kalpas.

original: de bas na la la dag de la mi 'jug cing sems zhum par gyur pa yod pas sems zhum pa'i dbang du mi btang zhing phan pa dang don chen po yod par bstan pa'i sgo nas dga' ba dang spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom
analyzed: de bas na la la dag de la mi 'jug cing sems zhum par gyur pa yod pas sems zhum pa'i dbang du mi btang zhing phan pa dang don chen po yod par bstan pa'i sgo nas dga' ba dang spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom
translated: In order to generate joy and delight by way of teaching that it is not to be given over to the power of a depressed mind and that it has great benefit and purpose, a verse is begun.

original: mo // gang phyir thog mar re ba bya dka' ste //
analyzed: mo // gang phyir thog mar re ba bya dka' ste //
translated: Because at first hope is difficult,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: re ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: re ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: hope is
