translated: the generation of the thought of enlightenment and the making of prayers.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la gzhag par bya'o zhes khas blangs shing smon lam gdab pa yang shin tu dka'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la gzhag par bya'o zhes khas blangs shing smon lam gdab pa yang shin tu dka'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In that regard, at first, when one is an ordinary being, it is very difficult to make a promise and to make a prayer, thinking, ‚ÄúHaving attained buddhahood in unsurpassed enlightenment, I will liberate all sentient beings from the wilderness of cyclic existence and establish them in nirvana and in the gnosis of omniscience.‚ÄùüîΩThis is the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúBecause at first hope is difficult.‚Äù

original: bskal pa stong phrag du mar de bsgrub dka'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bskal pa stong phrag du mar de bsgrub dka'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: That is difficult to accomplish for many thousands of eons.

original: de ltar byang chub tu sems bskyed nas kyang bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su bsgral bar bya ba'i phyir bskal ba grangs med pa gsum du mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa phyi nang gi dngos po la btang ba'i sgo nas mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas rim gyis sa bcu man chad du bsgrub pa yang shin tu
analyzed: de ltar byang chub tu sems bskyed nas kyang bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su bsgral bar bya ba'i phyir bskal ba grangs med pa gsum du mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa phyi nang gi dngos po la btang ba'i sgo nas mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas rim gyis sa bcu man chad du bsgrub pa yang shin tu
translated: Having generated the thought of awakening in that way, and also for the sake of attaining unsurpassed awakening and completely liberating sentient beings, it is very difficult to accomplish the stages from the stage of devoted conduct up to the tenth stage through giving one's head, legs, arms, and so forth, both internal and external things, for three incalculable eons.

original: dka'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dka'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of difficult to accomplish.

original: gang phyir sems can phan bya don phyir bsgrub //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: gang phyir sems can phan bya don phyir bsgrub // ces bya ba la /
translated: Because of accomplishing the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de ltar byang chub tu sems bskyed nas bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du dka' ba spyod pa'i sgo nas sa bcu man @32b chad bsgrubs te /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub tu sems bskyed nas bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du dka' ba spyod pa'i sgo nas sa bcu man @32b chad bsgrubs te /
translated: Having generated the thought of awakening in that way, through accomplishing the stages from the tenth stage up to the stage of buddhahood through the practice of austerities for three incalculable eons,

original: sa bcu 'das nas /
analyzed: sa bcu 'das nas /
translated: after passing beyond the tenth stage,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa thob pa dang ye shes gnyis su med pa mngon sum du gyur to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa thob pa dang ye shes gnyis su med pa mngon sum du gyur to //

analyzed: ye shes de ni sems can mya ngan las 'das par dgod pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la gzhag par bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pa yin te /

original: thabs des 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du sems can sgrol bar byed pas na /
analyzed: thabs des 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du sems can sgrol bar byed pas na /
translated: By that means, one liberates sentient beings until the end of cyclic life.

original: sems can phan bya don chen grub //
analyzed: sems can phan bya don chen grub //
translated: Thus, it is the great purpose to benefit sentient beings.

original: ces bya'o // de phyir theg chen 'di la skyabs don mchog //
analyzed: ces bya'o // de phyir theg chen 'di la skyabs don mchog //
translated: Therefore, this Great Vehicle is the supreme refuge.

original: ces bya ba la gong du bshad pa ltar theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis byang chub tu sems bskyed nas dka' ba spyad nas mjug tu sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i thabs sangs rgyas thob pas na theg pa chen po'i sgor skyabs su song bas na
analyzed: ces bya ba la gong du bshad pa ltar theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis byang chub tu sems bskyed nas dka' ba spyad nas mjug tu sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i thabs sangs rgyas thob pas na theg pa chen po'i sgor skyabs su song bas na

analyzed: de 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i skyabs song ba bas kyang mchog yin no //
translated: Therefore, having gone for refuge in the door of the Great Vehicle, one is superior to those who have gone for refuge in the mundane and supramundane refuges.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis mdor na don rnam pa gsum bstan te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis mdor na don rnam pa gsum bstan te /
translated: This verse teaches in brief three topics.

original: smon lam gyi khyad par dang / bsgrub pa'i khyad par dang / 'bras bu thob pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: smon lam gyi khyad par dang / bsgrub pa'i khyad par dang / 'bras bu thob pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The distinctive feature of the vow, the distinctive feature of the practice, and the distinctive feature of the attainment of the result.üîΩThe distinctive feature of the vow is indicated by the line:

original: gang phyir thog mar re ba bya dka' ste //
analyzed: gang phyir thog mar re ba bya dka' ste //
translated: Because it is difficult to have hope at the beginning.

original: zhes bya bas smon lam gyi khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas smon lam gyi khyad par bstan to //
translated: The distinctive feature of the practice is indicated by the line:

original: bskal pa stong phrag du mar de bsgrub dka' //
analyzed: bskal pa stong phrag du mar de bsgrub dka' //
translated: It is difficult to practice for many thousands of eons.

original: zhes bya bas sgrub pa'i khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas sgrub pa'i khyad par bstan to //
translated: The distinctive feature of the attainment of the result is indicated by the line:

analyzed: gang phyir sems can phan phyir don chen grub // ces bya bas 'bras bu thob pa'i khyad par bstan to //
translated: Because it is the accomplishment of the great purpose for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: grags pa'i rgyur bstan to zhes bya ba ni dka' ba spyod pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yin par grags te /

translated: It is taught as the cause of fame means that the bodhisattva practices of the stages and perfections, which are the performance of various austerities, are renowned as the cause of unsurpassed enlightenment.

analyzed: de nyid bla na med pa byang chub kyi rgyur bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement: It is taught as the cause of unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: sngar glengs pa'i thams cad du 'gro ba'i don gyi tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la gong du kun tu 'gro ba la sogs pa'i khyad par bzhis theg pa chen po la skyabs su song ba ste /
analyzed: sngar glengs pa'i thams cad du 'gro ba'i don gyi tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la gong du kun tu 'gro ba la sogs pa'i khyad par bzhis theg pa chen po la skyabs su song ba ste /
translated: The verse previously mentioned, ‚ÄúUniversal vehicle, meaning, verse‚Äù is the topic.üîΩThe verse is composed in order to explain extensively the meaning of ‚Äúuniversal vehicle‚Äù in the above passage, which states that one who has gone for refuge to the universal vehicle, etc.,

analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i skyabs su song bas 'phags so zhes glengs pa la kun tu 'gro ba'i don rgyas par bshad par bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: by going for refuge in the mundane and supramundane vehicles, is superior.üîΩThe verse states:üîΩThe wise who have gone to the universal vehicle,

original: sems can thams cad bsgral phyir gang bzhugs dang // theg pa ye shes kun song mkhas par ldan //üîΩmya ngan 'das la 'khor zhing ro gcig pa //
analyzed: sems can thams cad bsgral phyir gang bzhugs dang // theg pa ye shes kun song mkhas par ldan // mya ngan 'das la 'khor zhing ro gcig pa //
translated: who remain in order to liberate all beings,üîΩwho have gone to all vehicles, who are skilled in means,

analyzed: blo dang ldan pas kun 'gror 'di rig bya // zhes bya ba la kun tu 'gro ba rnam pa bzhi dang ldan @33a * //
translated: who are one taste in nirvana, should be known by the wise as universal.

original: pas kun tu 'gro ba khyad zhugs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: pas kun tu 'gro ba khyad zhugs par rig par bya ste /
translated: The universal vehicle is to be known as preeminent by virtue of its possession of four kinds of universality.

original: kun tu 'gro ba bzhi ni /
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba bzhi ni /
translated: The four kinds of universality are:

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las bsgral nas mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir zhugs te /
translated: The bodhisattvas are engaged in the liberation of all living beings from the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: 'dis ni sems can kun tu 'gro ba dang ldan par blta'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni sems can kun tu 'gro ba dang ldan par blta'o //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattvas are seen to be engaged in the universal welfare of living beings.

translated: The bodhisattvas generate the thought of enlightenment in order to become skilled in the vehicles of the disciples, the solitary sages, and the great vehicle.

original: 'dis ni theg pa kun tu 'gro ba dang ldan par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni theg pa kun tu 'gro ba dang ldan par bstan to //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattvas are seen to be engaged in the universal vehicle.

original: nyan thos dag ni gang zag la bdag med pa tsam rtogs par bya ba'i phyir sems bskyed la /
analyzed: nyan thos dag ni gang zag la bdag med pa tsam rtogs par bya ba'i phyir sems bskyed la /
translated: The disciples generate the thought in order to realize just the selflessness of persons.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa gnyis ka la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir sems bskyed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa gnyis ka la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir sems bskyed de /
translated: The bodhisattvas generate the thought in order to become skilled in both the selflessness of persons and of things.

analyzed: 'dis ni ye shes kun tu 'gro ba dang ldan par bstan to //
translated: This shows that it is endowed with the universal vehicle.

analyzed: nyan thos dag ni zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i phyir sems bskyed la /
translated: The disciples generate the thought in order to attain the nirvana which is a one-sided peace.üîΩThe bodhisattvas nirvana is universal,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa ni kun tu 'gro ba ste /üîΩ'khor bar yang 'gro /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa ni kun tu 'gro ba ste / 'khor bar yang 'gro /
translated: for it goes to cyclic existence

original: mya ngan las 'das par yang 'gro'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par yang 'gro'o //
translated: and it goes to nirvana.

original: de la 'khor ba ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la 'khor ba ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Therein, cyclic existence is the nature of the five aggregates.

original: zhi ba ni phung po lnga spangs ba'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni phung po lnga spangs ba'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'o //

original: ro gcig pa ni 'khor ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin yang de'o //
analyzed: ro gcig pa ni 'khor ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin yang de'o //
translated: The single taste is that the nature of cyclic existence is the nature of nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa 'khor ba'i rang bzhin yang de yin no zhes /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa 'khor ba'i rang bzhin yang de yin no zhes /
translated: The nature of nirvana is the nature of cyclic existence.

original: shes rab kyis ni mya ngan las 'das pa mi gtong /
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni mya ngan las 'das pa mi gtong /
translated: By wisdom, one does not abandon nirvana;

original: snying rjes 'khor bar mi gtong ste gnyi ga 'jug pas na mya ngan las 'das pa kun tu 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snying rjes 'khor bar mi gtong ste gnyi ga 'jug pas na mya ngan las 'das pa kun tu 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: by compassion, one does not abandon cyclic existence. Since one enters both, it is called ‚Äúomnipresent nirvana.‚Äù

original: de'i yon tan dang nyes pa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i yon tan dang nyes pa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because of the non-discrimination of its virtues and faults.

original: shes rab kyis 'khor ba stong par mthong bas 'khor ba'i nyes pa la mi rtog /
analyzed: shes rab kyis 'khor ba stong par mthong bas 'khor ba'i nyes pa la mi rtog /
translated: By wisdom, one sees cyclic existence as empty, so one does not discriminate the faults of cyclic existence.

original: snying rjes sems can gyi don bya ba la dga' bas na mya ngan @33b las 'das pa la yang yon tan du mi lta zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snying rjes sems can gyi don bya ba la dga' bas na mya ngan @33b las 'das pa la yang yon tan du mi lta zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By compassion, one delights in working for the welfare of sentient beings, so one does not see nirvana as virtuous. This is the meaning.

original: khas blangs pa'i don du tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khas blangs pa'i don du tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: A verse on the meaning of the vow.

original: kun tu 'gro ba'i don bshad nas /
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba'i don bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the meaning of universal,üîΩin order to explain extensively the meaning of the vow, he composes the verses.

original: khas blangs pa'i don rgya cher bshad pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khas blangs pa'i don rgya cher bshad pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: khas blangs pa'i don de yang khyad par rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: khas blangs pa'i don de yang khyad par rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, that meaning of the vow should be understood through three kinds of distinctions:

original: smon lam gyi khyad par dang / bsgrub pa'i khyad par dang / thob pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: smon lam gyi khyad par dang / bsgrub pa'i khyad par dang / thob pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: the distinction of aspiration, the distinction of practice, and the distinction of attainment.

original: dga' ba mang pos byang chub mchog tshol zhing //
analyzed: dga' ba mang pos byang chub mchog tshol zhing //
translated: Seeking supreme enlightenment with abundant joy,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: nyan thos dag dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su song na bdag mya ngan las 'das pa thob par shog shig ces khas len na /
analyzed: nyan thos dag dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su song na bdag mya ngan las 'das pa thob par shog shig ces khas len na /
translated: when the sravakas go for refuge to the Three Jewels, they vow, ‚ÄúMay I attain nirvana.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su song ba ni sangs rgyas gang la skyabs su song ba'i sangs rgyas de nyid kyi rang bzhin thob par shog shig ces khas len cing byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su song ba ni sangs rgyas gang la skyabs su song ba'i sangs rgyas de nyid kyi rang bzhin thob par shog shig ces khas len cing byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
translated: But when the bodhisattvas go for refuge to the Three Jewels, they vow, ‚ÄúMay I attain the very nature of the Buddha to whom I go for refuge,‚Äù and they generate the thought of enlightenment.

original: 'dis ni smon lam gyi khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni smon lam gyi khyad par bstan to //
translated: This shows the distinctive feature of the vow.

original: ci'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya bar sems bskyed ce na dga' ba mang po'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya bar sems bskyed ce na dga' ba mang po'i phyir te /
translated: Why does one generate the Thought in order to attain Buddhahood? Because of the many joys.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan thos nas dga' ba dang dad pa skyes te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan thos nas dga' ba dang dad pa skyes te /
translated: Having heard of the qualities of the Buddhas, the Lords, such as the powers and the fearlessnesses, one generates joy and faith.

original: yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas de bdag gis thob par bya'o snyam du sems pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang rnams skyo ba med par dka' ba spyod //
analyzed: yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas de bdag gis thob par bya'o snyam du sems pa'i phyir ro // gang rnams skyo ba med par dka' ba spyod //
translated: One thinks, I will attain that Buddhahood endowed with such qualities!

original: ces bya ba la /üîΩsems bskyed nas kyang sangs rgyas de thob par bya ba'i phyir mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa'i gtang bar bya ba dka' ba spyod pa'i sgo nas mos pas spyod pa'i sa yan chad sa bcu man chad skyo ba med par khas len te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la / sems bskyed nas kyang sangs rgyas de thob par bya ba'i phyir mgo dang rkang lag la sogs pa'i gtang bar bya ba dka' ba spyod pa'i sgo nas mos pas spyod pa'i sa yan chad sa bcu man chad skyo ba med par khas len te /
translated: Those who, without discouragement, practice the difficult

original: 'dis bsgrub pa'i khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis bsgrub pa'i khyad par bstan to //
translated: This shows the distinctive feature of practice.üîΩHaving generated the Thought, one accepts, without discouragement, the practice of the difficult, through the door of giving one's head, arms, legs, etc. in order to attain that Buddhahood.üîΩOne thinks, I will attain that Buddhahood endowed with such qualities!

original: rim par sangs rgyas kun mtshungs 'gro //
analyzed: rim par sangs rgyas kun mtshungs 'gro //
translated: And gradually becomes equal to all the Buddhas.

original: zhes bya ba la de ltar sa bcu man chad rim gyis bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la de ltar sa bcu man chad rim gyis bsgrubs nas /
translated: Having thus gradually accomplished the ten stages,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sar sangs rgyas par gyur pa dang / sangs rgyas kun dang sku mnyam pa dang / gsung mnyam pa dang / thugs mnyam pa dang / tshogs mnyam pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sar sangs rgyas par gyur pa dang / sangs rgyas kun dang sku mnyam pa dang / gsung mnyam pa dang / thugs mnyam pa dang / tshogs mnyam pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: he becomes a Buddha on the stage of a Buddha, and becomes equal to all the Buddhas in body, speech, mind, and accumulation.

original: 'dis ni 'bras bu'i khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'bras bu'i khyad par bstan to //
translated: This shows the distinction of the result.

original: sku gsum brnyes pas na sku mnyam mo //
analyzed: sku gsum brnyes pas na sku mnyam mo //
translated: He is equal in body because he has attained the three bodies.

original: ye shes bzhi brnyes pas na thugs mnyam mo //üîΩtshangs pa dang bya ka la ping ka'i dbyangs kyis so sor yang dag @34a * //
analyzed: ye shes bzhi brnyes pas na thugs mnyam mo // tshangs pa dang bya ka la ping ka'i dbyangs kyis so sor yang dag @34a * //
translated: He is equal in mind because he has attained the four knowledges.

original: par rig pa bzhis ston pas na gsung mnyam mo //
analyzed: par rig pa bzhis ston pas na gsung mnyam mo //
translated: He is equal in speech because he teaches with the four analytical knowledges, with a voice like Brahma or the kalavi·πÖka bird.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par brnyes pas na tshogs mnyam mo //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par brnyes pas na tshogs mnyam mo //
translated: He is equal in accumulation because he has attained the perfection of the accumulations of merit and knowledge.

original: khas blangs mchog tu blo ldan de rig bya //
analyzed: khas blangs mchog tu blo ldan de rig bya //
translated: The wise one should be known as the best of those who have taken the vow.

original: zhes bya ba la blo ldan ni byang chub sems dpa' la bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la blo ldan ni byang chub sems dpa' la bya ste /
translated: The wise one refers to the bodhisattva.

original: khyad par rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa las na byang chub sems dpa'i khas blangs pa las ni nyan thos kyi khas blangs pa dag pas mchog tu gyur par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyad par rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa las na byang chub sems dpa'i khas blangs pa las ni nyan thos kyi khas blangs pa dag pas mchog tu gyur par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In particular, it is superior to the commitments of the sravakas, because it is endowed with three special qualities.

original: yang khas blangs pa'i khyad par du sangs rgyas sras kyi mchog tu skyes pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gzhan gyis bstan to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang khas blangs pa'i khyad par du sangs rgyas sras kyi mchog tu skyes pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gzhan gyis bstan to zhes bya ba la /
translated: Another verse is stated to show the superiority of the bodhisattvas commitment, which is born as the supreme offspring of the buddhas.

original: gong du yon tan rnam pa gsum gyis khyad par khas blangs pa khyad zhugs par bstan nas /
analyzed: gong du yon tan rnam pa gsum gyis khyad par khas blangs pa khyad zhugs par bstan nas /
translated: Having shown the superiority of the commitment through the above three qualities,

original: da yang tshigs su bcad pa gzhan gyis khas blangs pa de khyad zhugs par ston te /
analyzed: da yang tshigs su bcad pa gzhan gyis khas blangs pa de khyad zhugs par ston te /
translated: now another verse shows the superiority of that commitment.

original: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it superior?

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed pa rnams kyang sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya mod kyi /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed pa rnams kyang sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya mod kyi /
translated: Although those who have generated the intention to achieve the enlightenment of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas are called offspring of the buddhas,

original: de dag gsung las skyes pa'i sras zhes bya'i thugs las skyes pa'i sras zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gsung las skyes pa'i sras zhes bya'i thugs las skyes pa'i sras zhes mi bya'o //
translated: They are called ‚Äúsons born from the speech‚Äù of the Buddhas, not ‚Äúsons born from the mind.‚Äù

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i sras rnams ni thugs las skyes pa'i sras yin pas sras kyi mchog tu skyes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i sras rnams ni thugs las skyes pa'i sras yin pas sras kyi mchog tu skyes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The sons who have generated the intention to achieve unsurpassable enlightenment are born from the mind. They are called ‚Äúthe best of sons.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas kyi sras kyi mchog tu skyes pa'i sgo nas kyang khas blangs pa'i khyad zhugs par ston to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sras kyi mchog tu skyes pa'i sgo nas kyang khas blangs pa'i khyad zhugs par ston to //
translated: This shows that the bodhisattvas are superior to the disciples in terms of the excellence of their commitment, since they are born as the best of the Buddha‚Äôs sons.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sras mchog tu ni gang skyes pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sras mchog tu ni gang skyes pa //
translated: The best of the Buddha‚Äôs sonsüîΩare endowed with mind, wisdom, and the accumulations, with compassion,

original: sems dang shes rab dang ni tshogs ldan snying rje dang // sa bon ma dang mngal gnas ma ma mtshungs pa med //üîΩde ni khas blangs mchog tu blo ldan shes par bya //
analyzed: sems dang shes rab dang ni tshogs ldan snying rje dang // sa bon ma dang mngal gnas ma ma mtshungs pa med // de ni khas blangs mchog tu blo ldan shes par bya //
translated: with a mother, a womb, and a nurse, without equal.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The wise should know that they are the best of those who have committed themselves.

original: 'di ltar 'khor los sgyur pa'i rgyal po'i sras kyang yon tan rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa dang / 'khor los sgyur pa'i rigs mi gcod par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khor los sgyur pa'i rgyal po'i sras kyang yon tan rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa dang / 'khor los sgyur pa'i rigs mi gcod par gnas pa yin te /
translated: In this way, the son of a wheel-turning king is endowed with four qualities and does not interrupt the lineage of a wheel-turning king.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: sa bon phun sum tshogs pa dang / ma phun sum tshogs pa dang / mngal phun sum tshogs pa dang / ma ma phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon phun sum tshogs pa dang / ma phun sum tshogs pa dang / mngal phun sum tshogs pa dang / ma ma phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The excellence of the seed, the excellence of the womb, and the excellence of the nurse.

original: de las bon phun sum tshogs pa ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po nyid kyis sa bon dang khu ba gzhag gi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de las bon phun sum tshogs pa ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po nyid kyis sa bon dang khu ba gzhag gi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: The excellence of the seed is that the seed and semen are deposited by the wheel-turning king himself, not by another.

original: ma phun sum tshogs pa yang sa bon de yang btsun mo dam pa la gzhag gi bran mo ngan pa la sogs pa la mi bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: ma phun sum tshogs pa yang sa bon de yang btsun mo dam pa la gzhag gi bran mo ngan pa la sogs pa la mi bzhag pa'o //
translated: The excellence of the mother is that the seed is deposited in a true wife, not in a servant woman or the like.

original: de @34b ltar na pha phun sum tshogs pa dang / ma phun sum tshogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de @34b ltar na pha phun sum tshogs pa dang / ma phun sum tshogs par 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, there is the excellence of the father and the excellence of the mother.

original: mngal gyi gnas kyang rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan la sogs pas nyams par yang ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: mngal gyi gnas kyang rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan la sogs pas nyams par yang ma byas pa'o //
translated: The womb is not damaged by wind, bile, phlegm, and so on.

original: de ltar na zhag dang zla ba la sogs pa tshang nas mngal yongs su rdzogs te /
analyzed: de ltar na zhag dang zla ba la sogs pa tshang nas mngal yongs su rdzogs te /
translated: Thus, after the full number of days and months, the womb is complete.

original: bde bar skyes nas kyang gal te ma mas bkru ba dang / nu ma snun pa la sogs pa zhal ta legs par byed pa'i lag tu song ste /
analyzed: bde bar skyes nas kyang gal te ma mas bkru ba dang / nu ma snun pa la sogs pa zhal ta legs par byed pa'i lag tu song ste /
translated: If the child is born safely and falls into the hands of a nurse who bathes it well, nurses it at the breast, and so on,

original: rim gyis skyes nas 'khor los sgyur ba'i rigs mi gcod par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rim gyis skyes nas 'khor los sgyur ba'i rigs mi gcod par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: it will gradually grow up and live without cutting off the lineage of a universal monarch.

original: de dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa' rnams mtshungs pa med pa rnam pa bzhi dang ldan par sangs rgyas kyi sras su skyes pa /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa' rnams mtshungs pa med pa rnam pa bzhi dang ldan par sangs rgyas kyi sras su skyes pa /
translated: In the same way, bodhisattvas, endowed with four kinds of incomparability, are born as the Buddha‚Äôs heirs.

original: de nyan thos la sogs pa'i khas blangs pa pas khas blangs pa'i mchog tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyan thos la sogs pa'i khas blangs pa pas khas blangs pa'i mchog tu rig par bya ste /
translated: They should be known as the best of those who make vows, better than the vows of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.

original: mtshungs pa med pa rnam pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: mtshungs pa med pa rnam pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four kinds of incomparability are as follows.

original: sa bon mtshungs pa med pa dang / ma mtshungs pa med pa dang / mngal gyi gnas mtshungs pa med pa dang / mam mtshungs pa med pa'o ;
analyzed: sa bon mtshungs pa med pa dang / ma mtshungs pa med pa dang / mngal gyi gnas mtshungs pa med pa dang / mam mtshungs pa med pa'o ;
translated: The seed is not the same as anything else, and it is not not the same as anything else. The womb is not the same as anything else, and it is not not the same as anything else.

original: / theg pa chen po la brten pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba'i sa bon ni byang chub kyi sems te /
analyzed: / theg pa chen po la brten pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba'i sa bon ni byang chub kyi sems te /
translated: The seed of the unsurpassed enlightenment of the bodhisattvas who rely on the Great Vehicle is the spirit of enlightenment.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas pas byang chub tu sems bskyed nas sa bon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas pas byang chub tu sems bskyed nas sa bon du 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, it becomes a seed when one who is established in the bodhisattva lineage generates the spirit of enlightenment.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can nam /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can nam /
translated: If one who is of the sravaka or pratyekabuddha lineage,

original: rigs med pas sems bskyed na ni sa bon du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs med pas sems bskyed na ni sa bon du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or one who is without lineage, generates the spirit of enlightenment, it does not become a seed.

original: sa bon de yang gal te pha rol tu phyin pa drug la /
analyzed: sa bon de yang gal te pha rol tu phyin pa drug la /
translated: Moreover, if that seed is in the six perfections,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mar 'gyur gyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan mar gyur na sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi gcod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mar 'gyur gyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan mar gyur na sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi gcod par 'gyur ro //
translated: it becomes the lineage of the buddhas when the perfection of wisdom is the mother and the other perfections are the fathers.

original: de la yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mngal gyi gnas lta bu dang ldan na 'tshang rgya ste ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mngal gyi gnas lta bu dang ldan na 'tshang rgya ste ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Moreover, if one has the accumulation of merit and wisdom, which is like a womb, one will become enlightened. Why is this?

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ni bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba'i rten du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ni bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba'i rten du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the accumulation of merit and wisdom is the basis for becoming enlightened in unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyang de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa ser sna la sogs pas dri ma can du ma byas na gdod 'tshang rgya ba'i rten du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyang de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa ser sna la sogs pas dri ma can du ma byas na gdod 'tshang rgya ba'i rten du 'gyur gyi /
translated: And the accumulation of merit and wisdom will be the basis for becoming enlightened if it is not defiled by stinginess and so on, which are adverse to it.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dri ma can du gyur pa'i rten du mi 'gyur ro //üîΩde ltar sangs rgyas kyi rigs su skyes nas kyang gal te snying rje chen pos ma ma byas te mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar ma ltung bar 'khor ba nas byang chub sems dpa'i @35a * //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dri ma can du gyur pa'i rten du mi 'gyur ro // de ltar sangs rgyas kyi rigs su skyes nas kyang gal te snying rje chen pos ma ma byas te mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar ma ltung bar 'khor ba nas byang chub sems dpa'i @35a * //
translated: But it will not be the basis if it is defiled by adverse elements.

original: spyod pa rgyun ma bcad na 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: spyod pa rgyun ma bcad na 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, even if one is born in the family of the Buddha, if one does not act as a mother through great compassion, and if one does not fall to the extreme of nirvana, but continues the bodhisattva's practice in samsara, one will become enlightened.

original: de ltar yon tan rnam pa bzhi dang ldan par skyes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi gcod par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yon tan rnam pa bzhi dang ldan par skyes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi gcod par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he is born with four qualities and abides without interrupting the lineage of the Buddha.

original: de ni mngon par skyes pa'i khyad par gyis //

original: zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: legs par skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de 'jig rten pa brgya byin la sogs pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa nyan thos la sogs pa'i lus pas kyang lus khyad zhugs par 'thob pas khas len ba de khyad par du 'phags par bstan pa de'i tshe tshigs

original: su bcad pa rtsom mo //
analyzed: su bcad pa rtsom mo //

translated: For example, the son of a universal emperor has physical strength that enables him to overcome the hosts of enemies.

analyzed: de bas na stobs khyad zhugs so //

original: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i sras su skyes pa de longs spyod kyi bde ba phun sum tshogs pa bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi sras su skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpas kyang /

analyzed: de bas na bde ba'i khyad par dang yang ldan no //

original: de dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i sras rgyal srid kyi gtsug lag dang / rig pa'i gnas la mkhas pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i sras rgyal srid kyi gtsug lag dang / rig pa'i gnas la mkhas pa bzhin du /

analyzed: sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i btson ra nas bsgral zhing mya ngan las 'das pa la 'khod par bya ba'i thabs gang yin pa mkhyen te /

translated: One who is well born is endowed with four qualities.üîΩFor example, a son of a universal monarch who is endowed with four qualities does not cut off the lineage of the universal monarch.

analyzed: yon tan rnam pa bzhi ni dbang bskur ba thob pa dang dbang thob pa med pa dang / lhag par bya ba brtags pa la mkhas pa @36a * //
translated: The four qualities are: obtaining empowerment, not obtaining empowerment, being skilled in investigating superior activities and being skilled in the means of accomplishing the result.üîΩ

analyzed: dang / tshar bcad pa dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa'o //

translated: so too the bodhisattvas who are born as the sons of the buddhas, when they attain the tenth level Cloud of Dharma, receive the consecration of the Dharma king's regent by the light rays of all the tathagatas of the ten directions.

analyzed: / 'dis ni dbang bskur ba thob par bstan to //

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

translated: in the same way, once the bodhisattva has obtained consecration on the tenth level, he possesses the gnosis that is the direct realization of all phenomena that are to be known, eliminated, manifested and meditated upon.

analyzed: 'di ni dbang thogs pa med par bstan to //

analyzed: sangs rgyas 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor ston pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The consciousness that displays the mandala of the retinue of buddhas.

original: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i sras de 'bangs rnams la don ci dang ci lta ba la mkhas pa dang / rgyal po'i gtsug lag dang / bzo'i gnas la mkhas pa bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i sras de 'bangs rnams la don ci dang ci lta ba la mkhas pa dang / rgyal po'i gtsug lag dang / bzo'i gnas la mkhas pa bzhin du /
translated: For example, the son of a universal emperor is skilled in whatever is useful for his subjects and is skilled in the royal sciences and the arts.

translated: Similarly, bodhisattvas who have received empowerment know whatever is taught in the Dharma and know the means of training the retinue of monks and nuns in the retinue of the Buddha.

original: 'dis ni lhag par bya ba brtag ba la mkhas par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni lhag par bya ba brtag ba la mkhas par bstan to //

original: dper na dbang bskur ba thob pa'i 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i sras nyes pa byed pa rnams tshar gcod cing chad pas gcod par yang nus la legs par byed pa rnams phan gdags shing bya dga' byin pa de bzhin du dbang bskur ba thob pa'i byang @36b

translated: Just as the sons of a chakravartin king who have received empowerment are able to punish and execute those who commit offenses and to benefit and reward those who do good,

translated: so too bodhisattvas who have received empowerment are able to benefit and encourage those who keep discipline and possess good qualities and to punish and execute those who do not keep the precepts and have faults.

original: 'dis ni tshar gcod cing phan 'dogs par byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni tshar gcod cing phan 'dogs par byed pa bstan to //

analyzed: de la don rnam pa bzhi byed pa ni blon po chen po'o //
translated: The great minister performs four kinds of actions.

original: bzhi gang zhen ;
analyzed: bzhi gang zhen ;
translated: What are the four?

analyzed: blon po chen po lta bur pha rol phyin la 'jug pa'i phyir // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because he enters the perfections like a great minister.

original: dpen na rgyal po'i blon po chen po rgyal pos thugs brtan par bya ba'i gnas yin pas zhal ta dag byed cing btsun mo dam pa'i nang du yang 'jug pa de bzhin du /

analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag @40a * //
translated: should practice the superior morality, the superior mind, and the superior wisdom.

original: pa'i shes rab bsgrub pa bas khyad zhugs par bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo //
analyzed: pa'i shes rab bsgrub pa bas khyad zhugs par bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo //
translated: The verse is composed in order to show that the going for refuge is superior to the wisdom of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: skyabs su 'gro ba 'dir song don chen te //
analyzed: skyabs su 'gro ba 'dir song don chen te //
translated: Here, the going for refuge has great meaning.

original: zhes bya ba la 'di zhes bye ba theg pa chen po dang sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'di zhes bye ba theg pa chen po dang sbyar te /
translated: Here means in the Great Vehicle.

original: theg pa chen po 'dir theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su song na bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs ba 'grub par 'gyur bas don che ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po 'dir theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su song na bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs ba 'grub par 'gyur bas don che ba zhes bya'o //
translated: If one goes for refuge to the Three Jewels in the Great Vehicle by the method of the Great Vehicle, one accomplishes the perfection of one's own goal and the perfection of others' goals, so it is called having great meaning.

original: yon tan mang po dpag med 'phel bar 'gyur //
analyzed: yon tan mang po dpag med 'phel bar 'gyur //
translated: One increases many immeasurable qualities.

original: zhes bya ba la de ltar byang chub tu sems bskyed nas sa rim bas bsgrubs nas sangs rgyas kyi sar mngon par sangs rgyas nas stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang ma 'dres pa dang byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i yon tan dpag tu med pa 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la de ltar byang chub tu sems bskyed nas sa rim bas bsgrubs nas sangs rgyas kyi sar mngon par sangs rgyas nas stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang ma 'dres pa dang byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i yon tan dpag tu med pa 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, having generated the thought of enlightenment, having practiced by stages, having attained manifest enlightenment in the stage of buddhahood, one obtains immeasurable qualities such as the powers, the fearlessnesses, the unique qualities of a buddha, and the factors of enlightenment.

original: de ltar bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir don che bar bstan no //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir don che bar bstan no //
translated: Thus, it is shown to be of great import because the fulfillment of one's own aim is accomplished.

original: theg pa chen por skyabs su song na gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa yang 'grub pas don che ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen por skyabs su song na gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa yang 'grub pas don che ste /
translated: When one has gone for refuge to the universal vehicle, the fulfillment of the aims of others is also accomplished. Thus, it is of great import.

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub pa yang bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pas bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub pa yang bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pas bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: The accomplishment of the fulfillment of the aims of others is shown to be accomplished by the fulfillment of aspiration and the fulfillment of application.

original: 'gro ba 'di dag snying rje bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di dag snying rje bsam mi khyab //
translated: These beings are to be pitied, for they are beyond the scope of thought.

original: mtshungs med 'phags chen chos kyang rgyas par byed //
analyzed: mtshungs med 'phags chen chos kyang rgyas par byed //
translated: The Dharma of the great noble ones is also to be spread.

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus, he says.

original: snying rje chen po'i bsam pas sems can thams cad la bye brag med par 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las bsgral bar bya'o snyam du sems te /
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i bsam pas sems can thams cad la bye brag med par 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las bsgral bar bya'o snyam du sems te /
translated: With the aspiration of great compassion, one thinks, I will liberate all sentient beings without distinction from the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: 'dis ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the fulfillment of aspiration.

original: de ltar bsams nas byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyi gang zag rnams la mtshungs pa med par 'phags pa chen po'i chos phyogs bcu thams cad du rgyas par ston cing 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar bsams nas byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyi gang zag rnams la mtshungs pa med par 'phags pa chen po'i chos phyogs bcu thams cad du rgyas par ston cing 'chad par byed de /
translated: Having reflected in this way, the bodhisattva who is a person of the spiritual lineage teaches and explains the Dharma of the great noble beings, which is unequalled and extensive in all the ten directions.

original: 'dis ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of application.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa 'byung ba'i theg pa chen po de nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pas khyad zhugs par 'phags pas mtshungs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa 'byung ba'i theg pa chen po de nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pas khyad zhugs par 'phags pas mtshungs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The Great Vehicle is unequalled because it is superior to the vehicles of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas, since it is the source of the perfection of one's own and others' goals.

original: nyan thos la'ang 'phags pa zhes gdags /üîΩrang sangs rgyas la'ang 'phags pa zhes gdags /
analyzed: nyan thos la'ang 'phags pa zhes gdags / rang sangs rgyas la'ang 'phags pa zhes gdags /
translated: The Sravakas are also called noble ones.üîΩThe Pratyekabuddhas are also called noble ones.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la yang 'phags pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la yang 'phags pa zhes bya la /
translated: The Buddhas and bodhisattvas are also called noble ones.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams @40b las kyang 'phags pa yin pas 'phags pa chen po zhes bya ste theg pa chen po 'di 'phags pa de dag gi chos yin pas na theg pa chan po la 'phags pa chen po'i
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams @40b las kyang 'phags pa yin pas 'phags pa chen po zhes bya ste theg pa chen po 'di 'phags pa de dag gi chos yin pas na theg pa chan po la 'phags pa chen po'i
translated: It is the great vehicle of the bodhisattvas because it is superior to the vehicles of the listeners and solitary realizers and it is also superior to the listeners' and solitary realizers' qualities.

original: chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the Dharma of the great beings because it is superior to the Dharma of the listeners and solitary realizers.

original: dpag tu med pa dang rtog ge dang grangs dang dus dpag tu med par rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dpag tu med pa dang rtog ge dang grangs dang dus dpag tu med par rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is to be known as immeasurable, as beyond reasoning, as beyond number and as beyond time.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan ni rtog ge pa rnams kyi mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas 'di tsam zhig yod de zhes 'chad cing dpag par mi nus pa dang / grangs kyi sgo nas kyang grangs 'bum zhe'am bye ba yod ces dpyad par mi nus pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan ni rtog ge pa rnams kyi mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas 'di tsam zhig yod de zhes 'chad cing dpag par mi nus pa dang / grangs kyi sgo nas kyang grangs 'bum zhe'am bye ba yod ces dpyad par mi nus pa dang /
translated: The qualities of the tathagatas cannot be measured by the valid cognition of direct perception and inference of logicians, who say, They exist to this extent, nor can they be measured by number, in terms of a hundred thousand or a billion.

original: dus kyi sgo nas kyang bskal pa grangs med par smras te brjod na yang mthar phyin par mi 'gyur bas na dpag tu med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dus kyi sgo nas kyang bskal pa grangs med par smras te brjod na yang mthar phyin par mi 'gyur bas na dpag tu med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is also said to be immeasurable in terms of time, for even if one were to speak for countless eons, one would not reach the end of its description.

original: skyabs su 'gro ba'i skabs bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: skyabs su 'gro ba'i skabs bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The section on taking refuge is completed.

original: // / skyabs su 'gro ba'i skabs kyi rjes la rigs kyi skabs bshad par 'brel ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: // / skyabs su 'gro ba'i skabs kyi rjes la rigs kyi skabs bshad par 'brel ba ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the connection between the section on taking refuge and the section on lineage that follows it?

original: gong du skyabs su 'gro ba'i bshad pa'i mjug tu /
analyzed: gong du skyabs su 'gro ba'i bshad pa'i mjug tu /
translated: At the end of the explanation of taking refuge above, it is said:

original: skyabs su 'gro ba 'di ra song don chen te //
analyzed: skyabs su 'gro ba 'di ra song don chen te //
translated: This going for refuge is of great import,

original: yon tan mang po dpag med 'phel bar 'gyur //
analyzed: yon tan mang po dpag med 'phel bar 'gyur //
translated: For it increases immeasurable, manifold good qualities.

original: 'gro ba 'di dag snying rje'i bsam pas khyab //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di dag snying rje'i bsam pas khyab //
translated: It is pervaded by the thought of compassion for these beings,

original: mtshungs med 'phags chen chos kyang rgyas par byed //
analyzed: mtshungs med 'phags chen chos kyang rgyas par byed //
translated: And it spreads the Dharma of the incomparable great saints.

original: ces smras pa'i tshigs su bcad pas //
analyzed: ces smras pa'i tshigs su bcad pas //
translated: By these verses,

original: theg pa chen po la skyabs su song bas ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa 'grub par byed pas don che ba bstan to //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la skyabs su song bas ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa 'grub par byed pas don che ba bstan to //
translated: it is shown that by going for refuge to the Great Vehicle, one accomplishes the complete fulfillment of one's own and others' goals, and so it is of great import.

original: de ltar bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa 'grub par byed pa de yang des pa med de /
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa 'grub par byed pa de yang des pa med de /
translated: Thus, the accomplishment of the perfect benefit of self and other is not without gentleness.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dang rigs med pa kun gyis theg pa chen po la skyabs su//
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dang rigs med pa kun gyis theg pa chen po la skyabs su//
translated: If all those of the sravaka and pratyekabuddha lineages and those without lineage take refuge in the Buddha and so on,

original: song na thams cad kyis don chen po de 'thob pa'am /
analyzed: song na thams cad kyis don chen po de 'thob pa'am /
translated: will they all obtain that great benefit?

original: 'on te nges pa yod de kun skyabs su song yang skyabs su song ba kha cig don chen po de 'grub kyi skyabs su song ba kun gyis mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'on te nges pa yod de kun skyabs su song yang skyabs su song ba kha cig don chen po de 'grub kyi skyabs su song ba kun gyis mi 'grub ste /
translated: Or is there a certainty that even though all take refuge, some who have taken refuge will accomplish that great benefit and others who have taken refuge will not accomplish it?

original: nges pa yod dam zhen /
analyzed: nges pa yod dam zhen /
translated: Is there a certainty?

original: lan du nges pa yod de /
analyzed: lan du nges pa yod de /
translated: The answer is that there is a certainty.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rigs can rnams skyabs su song na ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang yon tan gyi tshogs rnams 'phel bar 'gyur gyi nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dang / rigs med pa la sogs pas theg pa chen po'i tshul du skyabs su song yang yon tan de dag 'thob par mi 'gyur te /üîΩde bas na skyabs su 'gro @41a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rigs can rnams skyabs su song na ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang yon tan gyi tshogs rnams 'phel bar 'gyur gyi nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dang / rigs med pa la sogs pas theg pa chen po'i tshul du skyabs su song yang yon tan de dag 'thob par mi 'gyur te / de bas na skyabs su 'gro @41a * //
translated: But those who have the sravaka or pratyekabuddha lineage, or those who have no lineage, will not obtain those good qualities even if they go for refuge in the manner of the Great Vehicle.

original: ba'i skabs kyi rjes la rigs kyi skabs bshad par 'brel to //üîΩyang na ma nges pa'i rigs can dag theg pa chen por skyabs su song na don chen po de 'thob ste /
analyzed: ba'i skabs kyi rjes la rigs kyi skabs bshad par 'brel to // yang na ma nges pa'i rigs can dag theg pa chen por skyabs su song na don chen po de 'thob ste /
translated: Therefore, after the section on going for refuge, the section on lineage is explained.üîΩOr else, if those who have the unfixed lineage go for refuge in the Great Vehicle, they will obtain that great benefit.

original: ma nges pa'i rigs can la ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi mthar phyin du bsgral na gdod don chen po de 'thob kyi /
analyzed: ma nges pa'i rigs can la ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi mthar phyin du bsgral na gdod don chen po de 'thob kyi /
translated: For those who have the unfixed lineage, if they are rescued by a spiritual friend, they will eventually obtain that great benefit.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa las nyan thos la sogs pa'i bshes gnyen gyis drangs nas theg pa gzhan du yang 'tshang rgya bas gcig tu nges pa ni med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa las nyan thos la sogs pa'i bshes gnyen gyis drangs nas theg pa gzhan du yang 'tshang rgya bas gcig tu nges pa ni med do //
translated: Since one can attain enlightenment in another vehicle, having been led by a spiritual teacher who is a disciple, etc., while practicing the bodhisattva deeds, the spiritual gene is not absolutely certain.

original: yang na rigs 'di ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i skal ba can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na rigs 'di ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i skal ba can zhes bya ste /
translated: Or else, this spiritual gene is said to be the potentiality for generating the thought of enlightenment, for practicing the transcendences, and for attaining enlightenment.

original: de bcas na rigs ni chos de dag thams cad kyi sa bon yin no //
analyzed: de bcas na rigs ni chos de dag thams cad kyi sa bon yin no //
translated: Thus the spiritual gene is the seed of all those dharmas.

original: sa bon med par 'bras bu 'byung bar ma mthong ste /
analyzed: sa bon med par 'bras bu 'byung bar ma mthong ste /
translated: No fruit has ever been seen to arise without a seed.

original: de bas na rigs ni gong du skyabs su 'gro ba dang 'og nas byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs ba 'byung ba'i chos rnams kyi rgyu yin bar bstan pa'i phyir skyabs kyi rjes la rigs kyi skabs bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: de bas na rigs ni gong du skyabs su 'gro ba dang 'og nas byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs ba 'byung ba'i chos rnams kyi rgyu yin bar bstan pa'i phyir skyabs kyi rjes la rigs kyi skabs bshad par 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, the spiritual gene is taught to be the cause of the dharmas that arise later, such as going for refuge and generating the thought of enlightenment.

original: rigs rab tu dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rigs rab tu dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: A verse on the analysis of the spiritual gene.

original: nyan thos kyi rigs dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs yod par bstan pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi rigs dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs yod par bstan pa las brtsams te /
translated: The verse is composed beginning with the teaching of the existence of the spiritual genes of the disciples, the hermit buddha, and the bodhisattva.

original: dang por bsdus pa'i tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩyod dang zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi rigs can yang yod /üîΩrang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can yang yod ;
analyzed: dang por bsdus pa'i tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to // yod dang zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi rigs can yang yod / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can yang yod ;
translated: The first verse is composed in order to show the existence of the spiritual genes of the three vehicles.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rigs can yang yod par bstan to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩmchog dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rigs can yang yod par bstan to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // mchog dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word ‚Äúexistence‚Äù means that the spiritual genes of the disciples, the hermit buddhas, and the bodhisattvas are taught.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs pas kyang bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi rgyur gyur pas byang chub sems dpa'i rigs ni dam par gyur pa yin par yang bstan to //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs pas kyang bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi rgyur gyur pas byang chub sems dpa'i rigs ni dam par gyur pa yin par yang bstan to //
translated: The word ‚Äúsupreme‚Äù means that the bodhisattva gene is the best, since it is the cause of the benefit of both self and other, in comparison with the genes of the disciples and the hermit buddhas.

original: mtshan nyid dang zhes bya ba ni rigs rnam pa gsum las /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang zhes bya ba ni rigs rnam pa gsum las /
translated: The word ‚Äúcharacteristics‚Äù means that the bodhisattva gene is taught as having three characteristics.

original: theg pa chen po'i rigs kyi mtshan nyid dang / rang bzhin yang ston to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i rigs kyi mtshan nyid dang / rang bzhin yang ston to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It also shows the characteristics and nature of the MahƒÅyƒÅna lineage.

original: mtshan ma dang zhes bya ba ni sems can dag la theg pa chen po'i rigs yod par ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang zhes bya ba ni sems can dag la theg pa chen po'i rigs yod par ci mngon zhe na /
translated: The signs are as follows: If one asks, ‚ÄúHow is it known that sentient beings have the MahƒÅyƒÅna lineage?‚Äù

original: dper na gang na du ba snang ba de na mtshan ma des me yod par brtag pa dang / gang na chu bya snang ba de na chu yod par brtag pa bzhin du mchin ma dang rtags 'di lta bu dag snang na de la byang chub sems dpa'i rigs @41b yod par mngon no zhes bya ba yang ston to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dper na gang na du ba snang ba de na mtshan ma des me yod par brtag pa dang / gang na chu bya snang ba de na chu yod par brtag pa bzhin du mchin ma dang rtags 'di lta bu dag snang na de la byang chub sems dpa'i rigs @41b yod par mngon no zhes bya ba yang ston to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is like, for example, when smoke is seen, by that sign it is inferred that fire exists, and when water fowl are seen, it is inferred that water exists. In the same way, when such signs and marks are seen, it is known that the bodhisattva‚Äôs lineage exists.

original: rigs phye dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rigs phye dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The divisions are as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la phye na gnyis sam gsum du yod pa yang ston to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la phye na gnyis sam gsum du yod pa yang ston to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It also shows that if the bodhisattva‚Äôs lineage is divided, there are two or three types.

original: nyes pa dang ni zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yod kyang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas bsgribs na byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la mi 'jug cing bla na med pa'i byang chub ni myur du 'tshang rgyar mi btub
analyzed: nyes pa dang ni zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yod kyang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas bsgribs na byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la mi 'jug cing bla na med pa'i byang chub ni myur du 'tshang rgyar mi btub
translated: The phrase and faults means that even if one has the bodhisattva potential, if one is obscured by afflictions such as attachment and aversion, one does not engage in bodhisattva activities and cannot quickly attain unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: par rigs la sgrib pa'i skyon yang ston to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: par rigs la sgrib pa'i skyon yang ston to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is meant by it also shows the faults that obscure the potential.

original: legs pa dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs dang ldan na 'khor ba na sems can phal pa byed kyang bde ba dang / yon tan 'di dang 'di dag thob par 'gyur ro zhes rigs kyi yon tan yang ston to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: legs pa dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs dang ldan na 'khor ba na sems can phal pa byed kyang bde ba dang / yon tan 'di dang 'di dag thob par 'gyur ro zhes rigs kyi yon tan yang ston to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase and good qualities means that if one has the bodhisattva potential, one will obtain this and that happiness and good quality even though one is an ordinary being in samsara. This is what is meant by it also shows the good qualities of the potential.

original: rnam gnyis dpe dang zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa'i rigs te /
analyzed: rnam gnyis dpe dang zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa'i rigs te /
translated: The phrase two kinds of examples means that the bodhisattva potential is like a mine of the jewels of the six transcendent perfections.

original: gter chen po'i rigs dang 'dra ba dang / rin po che chen po'i rigs dang 'dra bas nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs pas kyang 'phags so zhes bya ba ston to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gter chen po'i rigs dang 'dra ba dang / rin po che chen po'i rigs dang 'dra bas nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs pas kyang 'phags so zhes bya ba ston to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and like the type of great treasure, and like the type of great jewel, it is superior to the types of Disciples, etc.

original: rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni yod pa la yang don rnam pa bzhis bstan pa las dpe rnam pa gnyis las re re zhing yang don rnam pa bzhi bzhir phye nas ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni yod pa la yang don rnam pa bzhis bstan pa las dpe rnam pa gnyis las re re zhing yang don rnam pa bzhi bzhir phye nas ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The four aspects are the four meanings taught in the four examples, each of which is divided into four aspects.

original: 'di ni rigs rab tu dbye ba bsdus pa'i don to //

analyzed: kha cig theg pa chen po'i rigs kyi rang bzhin can te rang bzhin mi mthun pa tshad med pa zhig yod do //

analyzed: gal te sems can thams cad kyi rigs gcig tu zad na /

original: 'di ni gtan tshigs gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gtan tshigs gnyis pa'o //

translated: Some persons who belong to the spiritual gene of the disciples, by the power of the condition of a spiritual teacher of the Great Vehicle, develop faith and devotion to the teaching of the Great Vehicle, as if they belonged to the Great Vehicle gene.üîΩBut some are able to practice the stages and transcendences,

original: gal te rigs gcig tu zad na kha cig gis theg pa chen po bsgrub nus na kha cig gis mi nus pa ci'i phyir 'gyur te thams cad kyis bsgrub nus par 'gyur ba'i rigs so //

analyzed: de ltar na kha cig @42b gis bsgrub nus /

analyzed: 'bras bu'i dbye ba dmigs pas na //

original: zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: 'bras bu bzang ngan gsum dmigs pas de skyed par byed ba'i rgyu yang rnam pa gsum med du mi rung ngo //
translated: Since the three types of good, bad, and neutral results are observed, the three types of causes that generate them are also indispensable.

original: 'jig rten yang 'bras dang nas la sogs pa dang shing tog rnam pa sna tshogs kyi 'bras bu tha dad pa snang ba de dag gi rgyu yang gcig tu ma zad kyi rgyu sna tshogs par yod pa bzhin du byang chub rnam pa gsum yod pas na de'i
analyzed: 'jig rten yang 'bras dang nas la sogs pa dang shing tog rnam pa sna tshogs kyi 'bras bu tha dad pa snang ba de dag gi rgyu yang gcig tu ma zad kyi rgyu sna tshogs par yod pa bzhin du byang chub rnam pa gsum yod pas na de'i

analyzed: rgyu rigs kyang rnam pa gsum med du mi rung ngo //

analyzed: gal te rigs gcig tu zad na 'bras bu rnam pa gsum du ci'i phyir 'gyur te ;

analyzed: rigs zhes kyang bya /

analyzed: rgyu zhes kyang bya /

analyzed: rigs tha dad pa gsum med na ci'i phyir theg pa rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ba mi rigs so //

analyzed: mchog tu rnam bar dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: A verse on the preeminence of the MahƒÅyƒÅna potential.üîΩThe word ‚Äúpreeminence‚Äù in the above summary is explained here by four topics.

translated: The verse is composed to show that the MahƒÅyƒÅna potential is preeminent.üîΩIt is preeminent in superiority, totality,

analyzed: khyad par 'phags dang thams cad dang // rigs chen dang ni mi zad phyir //

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i rgyu byed pa dang / dge ba thams cad kyi rgyu byed pa dang / dge ba don chen bo'i rgyu byed pa dang / dge ba ma'i zad ba'i rgyu byed pa'o //

translated: The sravakas' potential is not the cause of clear and brilliant virtue free from both the obscurations of affliction and the obscurations to omniscience.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyis ni nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyi ga dang bral ba'i ge ba gsal zhing dag la khyad par du 'phags pa'i rgyu byed pas na nyan thos kyi rigs pas khyad par 'phags par rig par bya'o //

translated: The bodhisattva potential is the cause of the special, clear, and pure excellences, and thus it should be understood as superior to the listener potential.

original: khyad par du 'phags zhes bya ba ni gsal ba dang dag pa la bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags zhes bya ba ni gsal ba dang dag pa la bya'o //
