analyzed: de la nyan thos kyi rigs kyis ni dge ba'i rtsab thams cad kyi rgyu mi byed de /
translated: In this regard, the listener potential does not act as the cause of all roots of virtue.

original: nyan thos rnams la stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'i dge ba med ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams la stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'i dge ba med ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because listeners do not have the virtues of the strengths, fearlessnesses, and unentangled qualities.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi rgyu byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi rgyu byed de /
translated: The bodhisattva potential acts as the cause of all roots of virtue.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs nas stobs dang mi 'jigs ba dang ma 'dres pa dang / sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs nas stobs dang mi 'jigs ba dang ma 'dres pa dang / sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because all the roots of virtue of the bodhisattva lineage, the powers, the fearlessnesses, the unshared qualities, the levels, the perfections and so on arise.

original: de bas na nyan thos kyi rigs pas khyad par 'phags par rig @43b bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na nyan thos kyi rigs pas khyad par 'phags par rig @43b bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the bodhisattva lineage is superior to the sravaka lineage.

original: nyon thos kyi rigs kyis ni bdag gi don tsam sgrub par zad kyi gzhan gyi don mi sgrub pas dge ba don chen po'i rgyu mi byed la byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyis ni bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga'i don sgrub pas dge ba'i don chen po'i rgyu byedüîΩpa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon thos kyi rigs kyis ni bdag gi don tsam sgrub par zad kyi gzhan gyi don mi sgrub pas dge ba don chen po'i rgyu mi byed la byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyis ni bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga'i don sgrub pas dge ba'i don chen po'i rgyu byedüîΩpa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sravaka lineage accomplishes only one's own goal and does not accomplish the goals of others, so it does not cause virtue of great benefit. But the bodhisattva lineage accomplishes the goals of both oneself and others, so it causes virtue of great benefit.

original: nyan thos kyi rigs las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du ni yod kyi phung po'i lhag ma ma lus bar spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das bar gyur na dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad
analyzed: nyan thos kyi rigs las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du ni yod kyi phung po'i lhag ma ma lus bar spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das bar gyur na dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad
translated: The roots of virtue that arise from the sravaka lineage exist until nirvana with remainder, but when nirvana without remainder is attained, all the roots of virtue

original: rgyun chad de /üîΩzad par 'gyur la byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyis ni phung po'i lhag ma ma lus par spangs te /
analyzed: rgyun chad de / zad par 'gyur la byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyis ni phung po'i lhag ma ma lus par spangs te /
translated: are cut off and exhausted.üîΩBut the roots of virtue of the bodhisattva lineage, such as the powers and fearlessnesses, serve as causes for their not being exhausted until the end of cyclic existence, even though nirvana without remainder is attained.

original: mya ngan las 'das par gyur kyang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du yang zad par mi 'gyur ba'i rgyu byed pas na nyan thos kyi rigs pas khyad par 'phags par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par gyur kyang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du yang zad par mi 'gyur ba'i rgyu byed pas na nyan thos kyi rigs pas khyad par 'phags par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the bodhisattva lineage is superior to the sravaka lineage.

original: mtshan nyid rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: A verse on the analysis of the characteristics of the lineage.

original: gong du bsdus pa'i don las mtshan nyid smos pa de la theg pa chen po'i rigs kyi mtshan nyid dang rang bzhin gang yin pa bstan te /
analyzed: gong du bsdus pa'i don las mtshan nyid smos pa de la theg pa chen po'i rigs kyi mtshan nyid dang rang bzhin gang yin pa bstan te /
translated: The characteristics mentioned in the above summary of the chapter are the characteristics and nature of the Mahayana lineage.

original: de yang mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi yod de zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo //
analyzed: de yang mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi yod de zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo //
translated: In order to demonstrate that there are four kinds of characteristics, the verse begins:üîΩIts nature, its development,

original: rang bzhin dang ni rgyas pa dang // gnas dang gnas pa'ang de yin te //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang ni rgyas pa dang // gnas dang gnas pa'ang de yin te //
translated: its support, and what is supported.

original: zhes bya ba la theg pa chen po'i rigs kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la theg pa chen po'i rigs kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The characteristics of the Mahayana lineage are of four kinds:

original: rang bzhin la gnas ba dang / yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang / gnas kyi rang bzhin dang / gnas pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin la gnas ba dang / yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang / gnas kyi rang bzhin dang / gnas pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: the nature of the lineage, the developed lineage, the supporting lineage, and the supported lineage.

original: de la rgyas pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs la bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la rgyas pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs la bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúdevelopment‚Äù should be understood to refer to the developed lineage.

original: de la rang bzhin la gnas pa ni 'khor pa thog ma med pa'i dus nas skye mched kyi khyad bar sus kyang ma byas ma bcos bar mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i sa bon dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin la gnas pa ni 'khor pa thog ma med pa'i dus nas skye mched kyi khyad bar sus kyang ma byas ma bcos bar mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i sa bon dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The naturally existing potential is the possession of the seed of manifest enlightenment, which has existed from beginningless time in cyclic existence, is not created by anyone, is not fabricated, and is the special domain of the faculties.

original: sa bon de dang ldan pas gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba'i skal ba yod pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon de dang ldan pas gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba'i skal ba yod pa'o //
translated: Because one possesses that seed, one has the fortune of being able to attain the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment without a doubt.

original: yang dag par bsgrubs pa ni rang bzhin gyi rigs la gnas ba'i byang chub sems dpa' dan ma dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod du bcug pa de'i tshe yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bsgrubs pa ni rang bzhin gyi rigs la gnas ba'i byang chub sems dpa' dan ma dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod du bcug pa de'i tshe yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs zhes bya'o //
translated: The developed potential is the naturally existing potential of a bodhisattva who has been induced by a spiritual master to generate the intention to achieve unsurpassed enlightenment and to practice the bodhisattva deeds.

original: yang na nges pa'i rigs can @44a * //
analyzed: yang na nges pa'i rigs can @44a * //
translated: Or, those who have the determined potential

original: rnams la ni rang bzhin la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnams la ni rang bzhin la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: are said to have the naturally existing potential.

original: ma nges pa'i rigs can rnams dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis btang nas theg pa chen po'i rigs su nges par byed pa rnams la ni yang dag par bsgrubs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma nges pa'i rigs can rnams dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis btang nas theg pa chen po'i rigs su nges par byed pa rnams la ni yang dag par bsgrubs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those of uncertain lineage who are led by spiritual masters to certainty in the lineage of the Great Vehicle are called ‚Äúthose who have correctly accomplished the lineage.‚Äù

original: yang na byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can rnams dang po nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'ba' zhig la zhugs pa rnams la ni rang bzhin la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can rnams dang po nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'ba' zhig la zhugs pa rnams la ni rang bzhin la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, those who are of the bodhisattva lineage and who from the very beginning engage in bodhisattva activities alone are called ‚Äúthose who abide by nature.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can nyan thos kyi spyad pa spyod pa las dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi dbang gis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa byed du bcug pa la ni yang dag par bsgrubs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can nyan thos kyi spyad pa spyod pa las dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi dbang gis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa byed du bcug pa la ni yang dag par bsgrubs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who are of the bodhisattva lineage but who practice the activities of the disciples and who, through the power of spiritual masters, are induced to practice the activities of the bodhisattvas are called ‚Äúthose who have correctly accomplished the lineage.‚Äù

original: dper na sa ni sems can rnams gnas pa'i gnas yin pas sems can ni de la gnas par byed pa yin pa bzhin du gang rang bzhin la gnas pa'i rigs de ni yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs kyi gnas yin la yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs ni
analyzed: dper na sa ni sems can rnams gnas pa'i gnas yin pas sems can ni de la gnas par byed pa yin pa bzhin du gang rang bzhin la gnas pa'i rigs de ni yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs kyi gnas yin la yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs ni
translated: Similarly, the naturally existing potential is the abode of the potential that is accomplished, and the potential that is accomplished

original: de la gnas par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de la gnas par byed pa yin te /
translated: abides in it.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rang bzhin gyi rigs la brten nas yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi rigs la brten nas yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the potential that is accomplished arises in dependence on the naturally existing potential.

original: yod dang med par shes par bya //
analyzed: yod dang med par shes par bya //
translated: It should be understood as both existent and nonexistent.

original: zhes bya ba la rang bzhin la gnas pa'i rigs ni rgyu yin la yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs ni rgyu de'i 'bras bu yin pas rang bzhin la gnas pa'i dus na ni rgyu'i mtshan nyid du yod la 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid du med pa zhes bya ste
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rang bzhin la gnas pa'i rigs ni rgyu yin la yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs ni rgyu de'i 'bras bu yin pas rang bzhin la gnas pa'i dus na ni rgyu'i mtshan nyid du yod la 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid du med pa zhes bya ste
translated: The naturally existing potential is the cause, and the potential that is accomplished is the result of that cause. Therefore, when it is the naturally existing potential, it is said to exist as the characteristic of the cause and not to exist as the characteristic of the result.

original: / rang bzhin la gnas pa tsam du byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / rang bzhin la gnas pa tsam du byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mere natural existence of the spiritual gene is not the effect of generating the thought of enlightenment, etc.

original: rgyur gyur pa'i rigs ni nam yang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid du mi rigs te /
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa'i rigs ni nam yang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid du mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that the spiritual gene as cause should ever be the effect.

original: rgyu de la brten nas byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi 'bras bu ni mi 'grub pa ma yin te 'grub bo //üîΩyang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs ni rgyu'i mtshan nyid du'ang yod /
analyzed: rgyu de la brten nas byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi 'bras bu ni mi 'grub pa ma yin te 'grub bo // yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rigs ni rgyu'i mtshan nyid du'ang yod /
translated: The effect of the spiritual gene as cause is not unaccomplished, since the generation of the thought of enlightenment and the qualities of the strengths, fearlessnesses, etc. are accomplished in dependence on that cause.

original: 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid du yang yod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid du yang yod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The spiritual gene as correct practice is said to have the characteristic of cause and also the characteristic of effect.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rang bzhin gyis kyang de'i tshe yod pas rgyu'i mtshan nyid du yang yod la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis kyang de'i tshe yod pas rgyu'i mtshan nyid du yang yod la /
translated: Because it exists at that time by nature, it has the characteristic of cause.

original: byang chub tu sems kyang bskyed pas 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyang yod do //
analyzed: byang chub tu sems kyang bskyed pas 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyang yod do //
translated: And because the thought of enlightenment is generated, it has the characteristic of effect.

original: yon tan ni sgrol ba'i don du'ang zhes bya ba la rigs zhes bya bas nges pa'i tshig ston te /
analyzed: yon tan ni sgrol ba'i don du'ang zhes bya ba la rigs zhes bya bas nges pa'i tshig ston te /
translated: The good qualities are also for the sake of liberation.  Family shows the etymology.

original: rgya gar skad du rigs la ni go tra zhes 'byung /
analyzed: rgya gar skad du rigs la ni go tra zhes 'byung /
translated: In the Indian language, family is called gotra.

original: @44b yon tan la ni gu na zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: @44b yon tan la ni gu na zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Good qualities are called guna.

original: go'i don ni gu na zhes 'byung ba yon tan gyi don du ta ra'i don ni sgrol ba'i don du 'gro ste /
analyzed: go'i don ni gu na zhes 'byung ba yon tan gyi don du ta ra'i don ni sgrol ba'i don du 'gro ste /
translated: The meaning of go is the meaning of guna, and the meaning of tara is the meaning of liberation.

original: rigs 'dis byang chub tu sems bskyed ba dang / mos bas spyod pa'i sa'i rim pa dang / sa bcu'i rim pa nas sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar gyi yon tan rnams mthar phyin cing sgrol bar byed la 'thob par byed pas na /
analyzed: rigs 'dis byang chub tu sems bskyed ba dang / mos bas spyod pa'i sa'i rim pa dang / sa bcu'i rim pa nas sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar gyi yon tan rnams mthar phyin cing sgrol bar byed la 'thob par byed pas na /
translated: This family perfects and liberates the good qualities from arousing the enlightenment mind in this family, through the stages of the level of practice through belief, through the stages of the ten levels, up to the level of buddhahood.

original: rigs la yon tan sgrol ba zhes bya ba'i don du 'dren to //
analyzed: rigs la yon tan sgrol ba zhes bya ba'i don du 'dren to //
translated: Therefore, family is interpreted as having the meaning of good qualities and liberation.

original: mtshan ma rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshan ma rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: A verse on the analysis of signs.

original: gong du bsdus pa'i don las mtshan ma zhes smos ba las /
analyzed: gong du bsdus pa'i don las mtshan ma zhes smos ba las /
translated: From among the topics summarized above, the verse mentions signs.

original: mtshan ma'i don rgyas par 'chad de /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i don rgyas par 'chad de /
translated: It explains the meaning of signs extensively.

original: dper na dud pa snang ba'i mtshan mas me yod par brtags pa dang / chu bya snang ba'i mtshan mas chu yod par brtags pa bzhin du mtshan ma'am rtags rnam pa bzhi snang ba de la /
analyzed: dper na dud pa snang ba'i mtshan mas me yod par brtags pa dang / chu bya snang ba'i mtshan mas chu yod par brtags pa bzhin du mtshan ma'am rtags rnam pa bzhi snang ba de la /
translated: For example, just as fire is inferred from the sign of the appearance of smoke, and water is inferred from the sign of the appearance of aquatic birds, in the same way, the existence of the bodhisattva potential is indicated by the appearance of four signs.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yod par bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yod par bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In order to demonstrate the existence of the bodhisattva potential, the verse is composed. This is the meaning.

original: snying rje dang ni zhes bya ba snga nas rab sbyor ba zhes bya ba gnyis su sbyar te /
analyzed: snying rje dang ni zhes bya ba snga nas rab sbyor ba zhes bya ba gnyis su sbyar te /
translated: Compassion and so on are to be connected with previously applied.

original: rab sbyor zhes bya ba ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab sbyor zhes bya ba ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa byed pa'o //
translated: Applied means generating the thought of awakening and so on.

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i sngon rol nas sems can gyi khams ni rtog pa rnam pa lngas sems can rtog ste /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i sngon rol nas sems can gyi khams ni rtog pa rnam pa lngas sems can rtog ste /
translated: Prior to generating the thought of awakening, the realm of sentient beings is conceived of as sentient beings through five types of conception.

original: sdug bsngal bar mthong nas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bar mthong nas /
translated: Having seen them as suffering,

original: sems can 'di dag gi rtog pa ji ltar bsam snyam du sems pa'i snying brtse ba yod na byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yod par rig bar bya ste /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag gi rtog pa ji ltar bsam snyam du sems pa'i snying brtse ba yod na byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yod par rig bar bya ste /
translated: If one has compassion, thinking, ‚ÄúHow can I think of a way to help these sentient beings?‚Äù one should know that one has the bodhisattva potential.

original: 'di ni mtshan ma dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan ma dang po'o //
translated: This is the first sign.

original: mos pa dang zhes bya ba la theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing rgya che ba'i don ma rtogs kyang theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing rgya che ba thos pa tsam gyis spu ldang ba dang mchi ma dku ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dad pa dang /
analyzed: mos pa dang zhes bya ba la theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing rgya che ba'i don ma rtogs kyang theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing rgya che ba thos pa tsam gyis spu ldang ba dang mchi ma dku ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dad pa dang /
translated: ‚ÄúInterest‚Äù means that, even though one has not understood the meaning of the profound and extensive teachings of the Great Vehicle, one has faith and interest in them, as indicated by the hairs on one‚Äôs body standing on end and tears coming to one‚Äôs eyes when one hears the profound and extensive teachings of the Great Vehicle.

original: mos pa skye na byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mos pa skye na byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: If one has this kind of faith and interest, one should know that one has the bodhisattva potential.

original: 'di ni mtshan ma gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan ma gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second sign.

original: bzod pa dang zhes bya ba la snying rje skyes nas sems can gyi don du mgo dang rkang lag gtong ba dang / gang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa'i dka' ba spyod pa rnam pa sna tshogs bzod de /
analyzed: bzod pa dang zhes bya ba la snying rje skyes nas sems can gyi don du mgo dang rkang lag gtong ba dang / gang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa'i dka' ba spyod pa rnam pa sna tshogs bzod de /
translated: ‚ÄúPatience‚Äù means that, having given rise to compassion, one is patient with the various hardships one must undergo for the sake of sentient beings, such as giving away one‚Äôs head and limbs and enduring hunger, thirst, heat, and cold.

original: dka' ba spyod pa rnams nyams su len na byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dka' ba spyod pa rnams nyams su len na byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: If they practice the difficult practices, one should know that they have the bodhisattva potential.

original: 'di ni mtshan ma gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan ma gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third sign.

original: dge bdag kyang yang dag spyod //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: dge bdag kyang yang dag spyod // ces bya ba la /
translated: They also practice virtue.

original: dge ba'i sgras ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bya ste /üîΩrang bzhin @45a * //
analyzed: dge ba'i sgras ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bya ste / rang bzhin @45a * //
translated: The word virtue refers to the six perfections.

original: gyis sbyin pa byed pa la dga' ba dang / rang bzhin gyis tshul khrims bsrung bar dga' ba dang / rang bzhin gyis bzod pa la gnas par dga' ba dang / rang bzhin gyis brtson 'grus rtsom par dga' ba dang / rang bzhin gyis bsam gtan la gnas par dga' ba dang /
analyzed: gyis sbyin pa byed pa la dga' ba dang / rang bzhin gyis tshul khrims bsrung bar dga' ba dang / rang bzhin gyis bzod pa la gnas par dga' ba dang / rang bzhin gyis brtson 'grus rtsom par dga' ba dang / rang bzhin gyis bsam gtan la gnas par dga' ba dang /
translated: If they naturally delight in generosity, naturally delight in guarding morality, naturally delight in being patient, naturally delight in making an effort, naturally delight in meditative concentration,

original: rang bzhin gyis shes rab rno na byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis shes rab rno na byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: and naturally have sharp wisdom, one should know that they have the bodhisattva potential.

original: 'di ni mtshan ma bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan ma bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth sign.

original: rigs rab tu dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la gong du bsdus pa'i don las rab tu dbye ba zhes smos pa la /
analyzed: rigs rab tu dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la gong du bsdus pa'i don las rab tu dbye ba zhes smos pa la /
translated: The chapter is called ‚ÄúThe Analysis of the Families‚Äù because it analyzes the families that were summarized above.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la phye na du yod pa ston te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la phye na du yod pa ston te /
translated: The chapter is composed in order to show how many kinds of bodhisattva families there are.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la phye na rnam pa bzhi yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad ba rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la phye na rnam pa bzhi yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad ba rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The chapter is composed in order to show that there are four kinds of bodhisattva families.

original: rigs ni nges dang ma nges ba //
analyzed: rigs ni nges dang ma nges ba //
translated: The families are definite or indefinite,

translated: Those of definite lineage are those who are definitely of the sravaka lineage, those who are definitely of the pratyekabuddha lineage and those who are definitely of the buddha lineage.üîΩThose definitely of the sravaka lineage attain the enlightenment of sravakas through that lineage and no matter what they do, they will never become the cause for attaining the enlightenment of pratyekabuddhas or buddhas.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs nges pa yang rigs des rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub nyid thob kyi ji ltar byas kyang nams kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub 'thob pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur ro //

translated: For example, Ajatashatru, who committed the five heinous actions, experienced the suffering of the hells like the snapping of a finger, by the power of his spiritual lineage.üîΩAnd the suffering experienced is slight.

analyzed: dper na gser rnam pa bzhi'i rten dang gzhi dang / sa bon byed ba'i gser la gser chen po'i rigs zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
translated: source is called the great gold family,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs 'di yang yon tan rnam pa bzhi'i gzhi dang rten byed pas gser chen po'i rigs dang 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs 'di yang yon tan rnam pa bzhi'i gzhi dang rten byed pas gser chen po'i rigs dang 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: so this bodhisattva potential is like the great gold family in that it is the basis and foundation of the four kinds of good qualities.

original: gser gyi rigs bzhin shes par bya //üîΩdpag tu @47a * //
analyzed: gser gyi rigs bzhin shes par bya // dpag tu @47a * //
translated: It should be understood as being like the gold family.

original: med pa dge ba'i gnas //
analyzed: med pa dge ba'i gnas //
translated: It is the immeasurable basis of virtue.

original: ye shes dri med ldan pa'i gnas //
analyzed: ye shes dri med ldan pa'i gnas //
translated: It is the basis of stainless pristine awareness.

original: mthun rnams kyi yang gnas yin no //
analyzed: mthun rnams kyi yang gnas yin no //
translated: It is the source of the concordances.

original: zhes bya ba la dper na gser chen po'i rigs ni gser mang po'i gnas byed pa dang / gser 'od gsal ba'i gnas byed pa dang / gser dri ma med pa'i gnas byed pa dang / gser las su rung ba'i gnas byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la dper na gser chen po'i rigs ni gser mang po'i gnas byed pa dang / gser 'od gsal ba'i gnas byed pa dang / gser dri ma med pa'i gnas byed pa dang / gser las su rung ba'i gnas byed do //
translated: For example, a gold mine is the source of much gold, the source of clear gold, the source of refined gold, and the source of workable gold.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyang yon tan rnam pa bzhi'i gnas byed pas na gser chen po'i rigs bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyang yon tan rnam pa bzhi'i gnas byed pas na gser chen po'i rigs bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva potential should be understood as a mine of gold, since it is the source of four kinds of qualities.

original: dper na gser chen po'i gser srang grangs 'bum phrag grangs med pa mang po 'byung ba'i gnas byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na gser chen po'i gser srang grangs 'bum phrag grangs med pa mang po 'byung ba'i gnas byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, a gold mine is the source of many hundreds of thousands of measures of gold.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs 'dis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sa dang byang chub kyi phyogs dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i dge ba dpag tu med pa'i gnas byed pas gser chen po'i rigs dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs 'dis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sa dang byang chub kyi phyogs dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i dge ba dpag tu med pa'i gnas byed pas gser chen po'i rigs dang 'dra'o //
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva potential is like a gold mine, since it is the source of immeasurable virtue, such as the transcendences, the stages, the elements that lead to enlightenment, the powers, the fearlessnesses, and so on.

original: dper na gser chen po'i rigs gser 'od 'bar zhing 'tsher ba'i gnas byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na gser chen po'i rigs gser 'od 'bar zhing 'tsher ba'i gnas byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the gold family is the basis for the radiance and brilliance of gold,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyis kyang chos rnams la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la phyin ci ma log par shes par byed pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor kun tu rtog pa'i ye shes dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyis kyang chos rnams la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la phyin ci ma log par shes par byed pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor kun tu rtog pa'i ye shes dang /
translated: in the same way, the bodhisattva family is the basis for the radiance and brilliance of the nonconceptual intuition, the intuition of sameness, the intuition of thorough differentiation, and the intuition of accomplishment of the task.

original: bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes gsal zhing 'od dang bcas pa'i gnas su gyur pas na gser chen po dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes gsal zhing 'od dang bcas pa'i gnas su gyur pas na gser chen po dang 'dra'o //
translated: Therefore, it is like the gold family.

original: gser la yang kha cig 'tsher zhing 'od gsal ba dang dri ma cung zad yod kyang 'od gsal lo zhes smras te /
analyzed: gser la yang kha cig 'tsher zhing 'od gsal ba dang dri ma cung zad yod kyang 'od gsal lo zhes smras te /
translated: Some say that gold is radiant and brilliant, but it has a slight stain, and so it is radiant.

original: gser chen po'i rigs las byung ba'i sger de la ni dri ma cung zad kyang med pas na dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gser chen po'i rigs las byung ba'i sger de la ni dri ma cung zad kyang med pas na dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: But the gold that comes from the gold family has not the slightest stain, and so it is called stainless.

original: yang gser kha cig ma bsregs pa'i tshe ser bar 'tsher mod kyi /
analyzed: yang gser kha cig ma bsregs pa'i tshe ser bar 'tsher mod kyi /
translated: Some say that gold is radiant and brilliant when it is not burned,üîΩbut when it is burned, it is not radiant and brilliant.

original: bsregs nas kha dog nag po dang skya bor 'gyur ba yod do //
analyzed: bsregs nas kha dog nag po dang skya bor 'gyur ba yod do //
translated: When it is burned, it becomes black or gray.

original: gser chen po'i rigs las skyes pa'i gser rnams la ni mer bsregs na yang kha dog 'gyur ba med pas dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gser chen po'i rigs las skyes pa'i gser rnams la ni mer bsregs na yang kha dog 'gyur ba med pas dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The gold that comes from the great gold mine does not change color when burned in fire, and so it is called ‚Äúpure.‚Äù

original: dper na gser chen po'i rigs dri ma med par byed pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i rigs 'di yang nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi dri ma thams cad spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas byed pas gser chen po'i rigs dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na gser chen po'i rigs dri ma med par byed pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i rigs 'di yang nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi dri ma thams cad spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas byed pas gser chen po'i rigs dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as the great gold mine is the source of pure gold, so this bodhisattva family is the source of nirvana, which is the elimination of all the stains of the latent afflictions.

original: dper na gser chen po'i rigs ni gser chen po'i rigs de las byung ba'i gser gyis mgo rgyan dang dpung rgyan la @47b sogs par byas na yang 'gas pa khro med par gser las su rung ba'i gnas su gyur pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na gser chen po'i rigs ni gser chen po'i rigs de las byung ba'i gser gyis mgo rgyan dang dpung rgyan la @47b sogs par byas na yang 'gas pa khro med par gser las su rung ba'i gnas su gyur pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the great gold mine is the source of gold, which is used to make such things as crowns and bracelets, and is not destroyed by being worked on the smith‚Äôs anvil, but becomes workable gold,üîΩso this bodhisattva family is the source of the bodhisattvas who are not destroyed by being worked on the anvil of suffering, but become workable for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs 'di yang rdzu 'phrul gyi mig la sogs pa mngon par shes pa'i gnas su 'gyur bas na gser chen po'i rigs dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs 'di yang rdzu 'phrul gyi mig la sogs pa mngon par shes pa'i gnas su 'gyur bas na gser chen po'i rigs dang 'dra'o //
translated: This spiritual potential of the bodhisattva is like the great mine of gold, since it is the basis for the superknowledges, such as the divine eye, etc.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma med par 'thob pa'i gnas dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma med par 'thob pa'i gnas dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the basis for the attainment of the absence of the stain of the passions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len spangs na de dang bral ba dag thob pa'i gnas dang / rten du rig ste gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len spangs na de dang bral ba dag thob pa'i gnas dang / rten du rig ste gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When the negative reflex actions of the passions are eliminated, the bodhisattva attains the absence of those passions, and the spiritual potential is recognized as the basis, the support for that.

original: yang na nyon mongs pa spangs na zag pa med cing dri ma med pa'i chos skye ste rigs de zag pa med pa'i chos mthong ba'i rten du gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs pa spangs na zag pa med cing dri ma med pa'i chos skye ste rigs de zag pa med pa'i chos mthong ba'i rten du gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Or else, when the passions are eliminated, the uncontaminated, stainless dharmas arise, and that spiritual potential is the basis for the vision of the uncontaminated dharmas.

original: rin po che chen po'i rigs kyi dpe'i tshigs su bcas pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rin po che chen po'i rigs kyi dpe'i tshigs su bcas pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: A verse on the similes for the great jewel spiritual potential.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs 'di ni rin po che chen po'i rigs dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs 'di ni rin po che chen po'i rigs dang 'dra ste /
translated: This spiritual potential of the bodhisattva is like the great jewel,

original: dper na rin po che chen po'i rigs rin po che chen po'i gzhi'i gnas byed pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i rigs de yang yon tan rnam pa bzhi'i gnas byed pas rin po che chen po'i rigs dang 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa
analyzed: dper na rin po che chen po'i rigs rin po che chen po'i gzhi'i gnas byed pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i rigs de yang yon tan rnam pa bzhi'i gnas byed pas rin po che chen po'i rigs dang 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is like a great jewel family, there is the verse

original: rtsom mo // rin po che rnam pa bzhi ni rigs phun sum tshogs pa dang / kha dog phun sum tshogs pa dang / dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshad phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtsom mo // rin po che rnam pa bzhi ni rigs phun sum tshogs pa dang / kha dog phun sum tshogs pa dang / dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshad phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The four kinds of jewels are the perfect family, the perfect color, the perfect shape, and the perfect size.

original: rin chen mchog rigs bzhir shes bya //
analyzed: rin chen mchog rigs bzhir shes bya //
translated: The supreme jewel family should be known as fourfold.

original: byang chub chen po'i rgyu yi phyir //
analyzed: byang chub chen po'i rgyu yi phyir //
translated: Because it is the cause of great enlightenment,

original: ye shes che dang ting 'dzin 'phags //
analyzed: ye shes che dang ting 'dzin 'phags //
translated: it is the cause of great intuition and of the exalted meditative concentrations.

original: sems can mang po'i gnas kyi phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can mang po'i gnas kyi phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is the basis for many beings,üîΩit is the basis for the great enlightenment of many beings.

original: dper na rin po che'i rigs ni lcags dang zangs dang mching bu la sogs pa 'byung ba'i gnas mi byed kyi mu tig la sogs pa'i rigs phun sum tshogs ba'i rin po che'i gnas su gyur pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na rin po che'i rigs ni lcags dang zangs dang mching bu la sogs pa 'byung ba'i gnas mi byed kyi mu tig la sogs pa'i rigs phun sum tshogs ba'i rin po che'i gnas su gyur pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, a precious gem does not come from such sources as iron, copper, and glass, but comes from a source of perfect precious gems such as pearls.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs de yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyi gnas su mi 'gyur gyi rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes las byung ba nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'i byang chub chen po'i gnas su gyur pas
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs de yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyi gnas su mi 'gyur gyi rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes las byung ba nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'i byang chub chen po'i gnas su gyur pas
translated: Similarly, the bodhisattva potential does not come from the sources of the enlightenment of the ≈õrƒÅvaka and pratyekabuddha, but comes from the source of the great enlightenment that arises after the vajra like concentration and is the elimination of all the afflictive obscurations.

original: na rin po che chen po'i rigs dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: na rin po che chen po'i rigs dang 'dra'o //
translated: Therefore, it is like a great precious gem.

original: dper na rin po che chen po'i rigs de rin po che 'tsher zhing 'bar ba'i gnas su 'gyur ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i rigs de yang me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa ye shes bzhi'i gnas su 'gyur bas rin po che chen po'i
analyzed: dper na rin po che chen po'i rigs de rin po che 'tsher zhing 'bar ba'i gnas su 'gyur ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i rigs de yang me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa ye shes bzhi'i gnas su 'gyur bas rin po che chen po'i
translated: Just as that great jewel family is the basis of jewels that are clear and shining, in the same way, the Bodhisattva family is the basis of the four knowledges, such as the mirror-like knowledge, etc.

original: rigs dang 'dra'o //üîΩdper na @48a * //
analyzed: rigs dang 'dra'o // dper na @48a * //
translated: Therefore, it is like a great jewel family.

original: rin po che chen po'i rigs de ni /
analyzed: rin po che chen po'i rigs de ni /
translated: Just as that great jewel family is the basis of great jewels,

original: rin po che chen po de zad de zad de'am chag pa dbyibs mi sdug pa ma yin pa gru bzhi dang zlum po la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyang mdzes ba'i gnas su 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: rin po che chen po de zad de zad de'am chag pa dbyibs mi sdug pa ma yin pa gru bzhi dang zlum po la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyang mdzes ba'i gnas su 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: whether they are exhausted or not exhausted, whether they are broken or not broken, and also of the beautiful shapes, such as square, round, etc.,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs 'di yang 'phags pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ; dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / nam mkha'i mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i gnas su gyur bas na rin po che chen po'i rigs dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs 'di yang 'phags pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ; dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / nam mkha'i mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i gnas su gyur bas na rin po che chen po'i rigs dang 'dra'o //
translated: in the same way, this Bodhisattva family is the basis of the noble concentrations, such as the concentration of going energetically, the concentration of the sky treasury, etc.üîΩTherefore, it is like a great jewel family.

original: dper na rin po che chen po'i rigs chen por dbyibs che ba dang / rin po che mang po'i gnas su 'gyur ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i rigs 'di yang sems can mtha' yas pa mang po mya ngan las 'das pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la 'jug pa'i gnas su 'gyur bas na rin po che chen po'i rigs dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na rin po che chen po'i rigs chen por dbyibs che ba dang / rin po che mang po'i gnas su 'gyur ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i rigs 'di yang sems can mtha' yas pa mang po mya ngan las 'das pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la 'jug pa'i gnas su 'gyur bas na rin po che chen po'i rigs dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as a great mine of jewels is a great source of the shapes of jewels and a great source of many jewels, in the same way, this spiritual gene of the bodhisattva is a great source of the many jewels of the infinite beings who enter into nirvana and the knowledge of a buddha.

original: rigs med pa la rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rigs med pa la rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: A verse on the analysis of the absence of the spiritual gene.

original: gong du nyan thos kyi rigs dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rigs dang / rigs ma nges pa bshad nas /
analyzed: gong du nyan thos kyi rigs dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rigs dang / rigs ma nges pa bshad nas /
translated: The spiritual gene of the disciples, the gene of the hermit buddhas, the gene of the bodhisattvas, and the uncommitted gene have been discussed.

original: da ni rigs med pa 'chad de /üîΩrigs med pa zhes bya ba 'di yong ye mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: da ni rigs med pa 'chad de / rigs med pa zhes bya ba 'di yong ye mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
translated: Now the absence of the spiritual gene is discussed.üîΩThe absence of the spiritual gene is the absence of the potential for perfect enlightenment.

original: nam yang mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i phyir rigs zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: nam yang mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i phyir rigs zhes bya ba'am /
translated: It is called the absence of the spiritual gene because it is the absence of the spiritual gene, that is, the absence of the potential for perfect enlightenment.

original: 'on kyang bskal pa dus thang cig zad cig tu mya ngan las mi 'da' la phyis mya ngan las 'da' ba la rigs med pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang bskal pa dus thang cig zad cig tu mya ngan las mi 'da' la phyis mya ngan las 'da' ba la rigs med pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: But if one is not liberated from cyclic existence for a long time, and later is liberated, then one is said to be of unfixed potential.

original: de gnyis ka la rigs med pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo //
analyzed: de gnyis ka la rigs med pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rtsom mo //
translated: In order to teach that both of these are of unfixed potential, the root text states:

original: la la gcig tu mi dge spyod //
analyzed: la la gcig tu mi dge spyod //
translated: Some engage in nonvirtue exclusively.

original: la la dge ba'i chos rnams bcom //
analyzed: la la dge ba'i chos rnams bcom //
translated: Some destroy virtuous natures.

original: la la mthar phyogs dge ba med /
analyzed: la la mthar phyogs dge ba med /
translated: Some have no virtue in the direction of the end.üîΩSome have little virtue.

original: dkar po chung yod rgyu dang bral /üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dkar po chung yod rgyu dang bral / zhes bya ba la /
translated: Some are devoid of the cause.

original: rigs med pa zhes bya ba'i don ni theg pa gsum gyi mya ngan las 'das par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' zhing mya ngan las 'da' bar skal ba med pa'i rang bzhin can la bya ste /
analyzed: rigs med pa zhes bya ba'i don ni theg pa gsum gyi mya ngan las 'das par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' zhing mya ngan las 'da' bar skal ba med pa'i rang bzhin can la bya ste /
translated: The meaning of unfixed potential is that one is by nature not fit to attain nirvana through any of the three vehicles, and one does not attain nirvana.

original: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those who do not attain nirvana are of two types:

original: de'i dus su yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can dang / de'i dus na mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: de'i dus su yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can dang / de'i dus na mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can no //
translated: At that time, they are those whose nature is not to pass into complete nirvana, and at that time, they are those whose nature is not to pass into nirvana.

original: de'i dus su yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de'i dus su yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types of those whose nature is not to pass into complete nirvana at that time.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?üîΩTherefore, it says,

original: de'i phyir / la la gcig tu mi dge spyod //üîΩces smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / la la gcig tu mi dge spyod // ces smos te /
translated: Some definitely engage in nonvirtue.

original: @48b 'di'i las nges par byed pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: @48b 'di'i las nges par byed pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is stated from the perspective of those who definitely engage in karma.

original: de la gang zag kha cig la byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yod kyang las nges par byed par 'gyur ba'i dbang gis ma gsod pa la sogs pa mtshams med pa'i las gdon mi za bar byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gang zag kha cig la byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yod kyang las nges par byed par 'gyur ba'i dbang gis ma gsod pa la sogs pa mtshams med pa'i las gdon mi za bar byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Here, some individuals have the bodhisattva potential, but due to the power of definitely engaging in karma, they will definitely commit heinous actions such as killing their mother.

original: de'i dus na rigs yod kyang ma gsod pa'i las ngan pa byas pas rigs des mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i dus na rigs yod kyang ma gsod pa'i las ngan pa byas pas rigs des mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, even though they have the potential, due to committing the bad karma of killing their mother, they will not attain nirvana through that potential.

original: de bas na de yang de'i dus na yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can yin pas rigs med pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na de yang de'i dus na yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can yin pas rigs med pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, since they will not pass into parinirvana at that time, they are said to lack the lineage.

original: 'di ni rnam pa gcig go //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa gcig go //
translated: This is one type.
